texts.es:
Rigoberto, reside en El Transito, departamento de San Miguel, se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado y cultivo agrícola (maíz y frijol), vive con su esposa y tienen una hija de 2 años de edad; él tiene tres años de dedicarse a las actividades agrícolas de 6:00am a 3:00pm, todos los días martes comercializa ganado ya que ese día se ofrecen en el mercado del tiangue la ganadería. 
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono y fertilizantes, ya que se dispone a iniciar la siembra de maíz y frijol, este préstamo le ayudara a tener todos los insumos necesarios para cuidar del cultivo, le permitirá la siembra de maíz y la posibilidad de tener una buena cosecha.
Su objetivo es sacar a su familia adelante, que su hija crezca y pueda superarse.
texts.en:
Rigoberto lives in El Transito in the department of San Miguel.  He has a business raising and selling livestock and farming (corn and beans.)  He lives with his wife and they have a 2 year-old daughter.  He has been farming for 3 years from 6am until 3pm each day.  On Tuesdays he sells livestock, since on this day there is a livestock market in Tiangue.  

He is requesting a loan to purchase manure and fertilizers, since he is ready to start planting his corn and bean crops.  This loan will help him to have all of the supplies he needs to care for his crops.  This will allow him to cultivate his corn and have the possibility of a good harvest. 

His goal is to get ahead with his family, so that his daughter can grow up and do well in life.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is a married woman with five children. Four of her attend school while one is still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees and clothes for the family.

For the past 5 years, she has operated a vegetable stall selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. In addition, she operates a goat selling business which contributes to her income. Sofia faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of vegetables and goats for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of vegetables and goats for resale

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel has operated a farming business for the past two years, selling farm supplies from his shop. His customers are his neighbors and passers-by. Daniel faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He dreams of expanding his business and gaining more income in the future.

He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business. With the Kshs 20,000 loan, he wants to purchase fertilizers for his farm supplies business. 

Daniel and his wife have two children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for his farm supplies business

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey, 49, resides in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. 

Srey sells groceries, earning an income of $10 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband, who is employed at a local market, earning an income of $2 per day. 

Each month, the family has to spend $100 on food and $15 on the other necessary expenses. 

Srey is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase vegetable seeds to grow more crops to sell. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy seeds to grow more crops to sell in the store.

loans.name: Sasun

texts.en: Sasun works at the village hall. Nonetheless, his family’s main income comes from agriculture. Sasun has his own agricultural machinery. He keeps cattle, has an orchard and cultivates land. Sasun would like to increase the number of livestock and develop his business further. With the requested loan, he plans to purchase calves. Increasing the number of livestock will help Sasun to get more income and improve his family’s living conditions. Sasun lives together with his wife and three children.

loans.use: to pay for calves

loans.name: 1 Nam Ngan Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hoa has a retail business selling dried food. She is requesting a loan to purchase processed seafood to resell.

Hoa is 57 years old and is married with 3 children.
She is the leader of a 5-member group, the 1 Nam Ngan solidarity group. 
Hoa lives with 1 dependant in Thanh Hoa city, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2009, Hoa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Hoa has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Hoa hopes for her business to do well, to build a new house and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: To purchase dried food to resell

loans.name: Jivralyn

texts.en:
Jivralyn is 33 years old and married to a tricycle driver. They have been blessed with four children. They live in the province of Cagayan. To add to her family's income, Jivralyn raises hogs for fattening and breeding. She has had this business for almost ten years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP for each hog disposal.
 
Currently, all of her pigs are gone, which is why she is asking for a loan to purchase new piglets to raise. She also needs to buy feed for the piglets. Her previous income went to her family's expenses and other obligations. In order to continue doing business, she is requesting a loan. She hopes this loan will help her expand her hog-raising venture. 
 
In the future, Jivralyn would like to strengthen her business in order to provide a successful living for her family.

loans.use: to purchase new piglets and feed

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with one child who is too young for school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and electricity bills.

Mary has operated a clothes selling business for over ten years.  She sells in a shop to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Munhbat

texts.en: Munhbat is 46 years old and lives with his two children and wife in a house in Hovd province of Mongolia. He remarried in 2010 after his first wife died. His two children are college students. Munhbat started to sell wood and coal at the local market in 2006. He has many regular clients after selling wood for several years. He sells wood and coal to the local public showers. He is planning to fix his home. With the profit from the business, he pays his children's tuition fees. He is a diligent man who is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to buy more wood and coal.

loans.use: To buy more wood and coal

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en: Genalyn is 44 years old and married with 3 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of PHP 10,000 from Kiva's partner, NWTF, to purchase more items like soft drinks, soap, bread and other groceries to sell. Genalyn has borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 1 year and also earns an income from selling rice. Genalyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy items like soft drinks, soap, bread and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Vabati Vebasa Group

texts.en:
Joyce is 43 years old and lives in Gweru. She has three children who are ages 12, 19 and 21. Two of her children are attending school and she looks after 5 dependents.

Joyce sells peanut butter, pots and plates. She has been in this business for 2 years. Her challenges include late payments by clients and shortage of funds. The loan of $400 that she is applying for will be used to purchase a peanut butter making machine and ground nuts. With additional income obtained from this business, Joyce will have more disposable income that will enable her to adequately provide for her extended family.

Joyce plans to own a kitchenware shop and produce more peanut butter for sale in the near future.

loans.use: to buy a peanut butter making machine and ground nuts

loans.name: Benilda

texts.es: Benilda, de 23 años es una valerosa madre soltera de 3 hijos: Flor, Cindy y Joemel. Juntos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad nativa Santa María. A pesar de su corta edad, ella logró muchas cosas. Cuenta con 8 terrenos productivos en donde siembra café, achiote, plátano y maíz, sus principales sembríos. Ella trabaja con mucho esmero, desde las primeras horas de la mañana hasta el atardecer, pues sabe que es el único soporte de su familia. Además de ser muy astuta y aprovechar al máximo su tiempo, ya que también cría gallinas de campo, los cuales enseba para luego venderlas a un mayor precio. Ya tiene 9 años de experiencia y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es su independencia, pues tiene la libertad de disponer de su dinero y las decisiones para la mejora de su negocio, más le dificultad la falta de apoyo, por eso tiene que contratar constantemente peones para que le ayuden en el mantenimiento y desarrollo de sus cultivos. Su objetivo es obtener una estabilidad económica para brindar a sus hijos una buena educación. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los amigos cafetaleros” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde agradece la oportunidad que le brindan. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Benilda piensa sembrar plátano y maíz en sus terrenos agrícolas. Por ello de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en el pago de los peones que le ayudarán a posear (orificios en la tierra para plantar semilla e injertos).
texts.en:
23-year-old Benilda is a courageous single mother who has three children: Flor, Cindy and Joemel.  They live together in their own home which is located in the indigenous community of Santa María.

In spite of her young age, Benilda has achieved many things.  She has eight plots of land where she grows coffee, annatto, bananas and corn.  These are her main crops.  She works with a lot of care, from very early in the morning until nightfall, as she knows that this is the only source of support for her family.  In addition to being very smart, Benilda makes the most of her time as she also raises hens which she fattens and then sells at a higher price.  She has nine years experience and what she most enjoys about her work is her independence as she has freedom with her money and the freedom to make her own decisions in order to improve her business.  The difficulty she faces is a lack of support.  For this reason, she constantly has to hire laborers to help her maintain and develop her crops.  Her goal is to achieve financial stability so that she can provide her children with a good education.

Benilda is a member of the 'Los Amigos Cafetaleros' community bank and this is her first loan from MFP.  She is grateful for the opportunity that she is being given.  For her part, she pledges to make her loan repayments on time.  Benilda is planning to grow bananas and corn on her land.  With your support, she will invest the money she has requested in paying laborers to help her 'posear' (make smalls holes in the ground in order to plant seeds and grafted plants).

loans.use: to hire laborers

loans.name: Nareman

texts.en: Nareman is a 32-year-old young woman. She is married and has two sons and one daughter. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. He also owns a taxi and works as a taxi driver. Nareman wants to help her husband pay for insuring and licensing the taxi, but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, so she needs to take out a loan of $1,200 from FATEN. When Nareman gets the loan, which will be repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to help her husband pay the expense of insuring and licensing the taxi. This will enable her husband to work extra hours and take internal and external transport, which will increase his income and give the family better living conditions. Nareman is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed next to the taxi.

loans.use: to pay for insuring and licensing the taxi

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en: Rodolfo is married with 4 kids. He is 45 years old and resides in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. Rodolfo owns and operates a fish selling venture to make a living, and has had this business for more than 3 years. Each month, he earns PHP 7,000 doing this type of work. Since he fully repaid his previous loan last year, he has requested a new loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 to purchase new fishing equipment and fish to sell. Rodolfo has been a member of GDMPC for more than 2 years. Rodolfo wishes that his business will grow, and his living conditions will also be good.

loans.use: to purchase new fishing equipment and fish to sell.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.es:
El señor Gabriel esta empezando a construir su vivienda de material mas duradera y segura y que actual mente tiene una casa de madera, pero ya esta en muy malas condiciones y le preocupa la seguridad de su familia. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para terminar un cuarto y el baño que con sus ahorros pudo iniciar la construcción pero le esta haciendo falta el techo y el desea ponerlo de concreto, pero no cuenta por el momento con el dinero necesario y comprar el material que es (cemento, arena y varilla). 
Don Gabriel tiene ya mas de 20 años dedicándose a la reparación y venta aparatos eléctricos, con una parte de las ganancias planea pagar el crédito y que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia. Ya que su esposa la señora Rosa Alicia de encarga de cuidar y atender a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gabriel is embarking on building his home using the most durable and safe materials. Currently he has a house made of wood, but it is now in very poor condition and he is worried for his family's safety. 

He is applying for a loan to finish a bedroom and a bathroom, the construction of which he was able to start upon using his savings. However, he still needs the roof, which he would like to be concrete, and he does not currently have the money required to buy the materials (cement, sand and rods). 

Gabriel has spent over 20 years repairing and selling electrical appliances for a living, and with a portion of his profits he plans to pay back the loan. This is the only source of income that he has for his family, as his wife Rosa Alicia takes responsibility for looking after their children.

loans.use: to fit a concrete roof in a bedroom and bathroom.

loans.name: Philomene

texts.fr:
Cliente de 55 ans, celibataire et mère de 5 enfants dont deux sont encore sur le banc de l'école. Elle s'est lancée dans la vente des vêtements et layette il y'a de cela 30 ans, quand elle se sépare avec le père de ses enfants.
Donc pour subvenir a ses besoins et prendre soin de ses enfants, elle ouvre un étalage et renforce son activité lorsqu'elle obtient le premier prêt de Hope, elle renforce son activité et se fait un capital et ses ventes augmentent automatiquement, parce qu'elle ne prenait plus a crédit, elle s'approvisionnait dans les grandes boutiques de la place.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle fera autant, et achète tous ce qui est nécessaire pour les nouveaux nés.les bavoirs, les pulls, ensemble de tricot, barboteuses, couvertures, couches...

Elle a pour objectif d'ouvrir une grande boutique et devenir grossiste, elle s'occupe valablement de ses enfants, et elle est prise comme modèle des femmes dans son quartier.
texts.en:
This client is a 55-year-old single woman and the mother of five children, two of whom are still at school. She began selling clothing and babywear some thirty years ago, when she separated from the father of her children. 

In order to cover her needs and to be able to take care of her children, she opened a stall and strengthened her business when she got her first loan from Hope. She grew the business, obtained working capital and her sales automatically increased, because she no longer bought on credit - she was able to purchase stock in the large stores in town. 

With this new loan, she will do the same, and will buy everything that newborn babies need - bibs, jumpers, knitted outfits, romper suits, blankets and diapers, etc. 

Her goal is to open a large store and to become a wholesaler. She takes good care of her children and is seen as something of a role model among the women in her neighbourhood.

loans.use: To buy children's outfits, diapers, and other clothing for resale

loans.name: Lucien Sèmawon

texts.fr: Lucien Sèmawon est âgé de 32 ans et vit au Bénin. Lucien Sèmawon est marié à une revendeuse du nom de Honorine. Le couple a trois enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Lucien Sèmawon exerce depuis une dizaine d’années le métier d’ajustage. Grâce au revenu que lui génèrent cette activité, Lucien Sèmawon contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Lucien Sèmawon sollicite pour une deuxième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit reçu antérieurement par Lucien Sèmawon a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: Lucien Sèmawon is 32 years old and lives in Benin.  Lucien Sèmawon is married to a reseller named Honorine.  Together they have three children whom they financially support.  Some of their children go to school and all live with their parents.  Lucien and Honorine take care of the household together.  In order to support himself and his family, Lucien Sèmawon has been working as a metal worker for about ten years.  With his income, Lucien Sèmawon helps meet his family's various expenses.  Because the number of his customers is increasing, Lucien Sèmawon is requesting a second loan from ALIDé.  His previous loan was well reimbursed.

loans.use: To buy metal pieces (iron rods etc...) for metalwork.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. 

Ruth has a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Ruth has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Ruth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Luz Idalia

texts.es:
Doña Luz Idalia tiene 36 años de edad, vive con sus tres hijas y se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, la produccion es en dos jornadas una por la mañana y la otra por las tardes, sus clientes le visitan todos los dias (lunes a domingo), el credito lo utilizara para la compra de los materiales para la produccion de tortillas, en estos momentos los pedidos de sus clientes han aumentado y no logra cumplir con todas las exigencias de los clientes, necesita el capital para poder producir mas.

la meta de Luz Idalia es que sus hijas se graduen del colegio.
texts.en:
Luz Idalia is 36 years old and lives with her three daughters.  She makes and sells tortillas for a living.  She makes them in two shifts, one in the morning and one in the afternoon.  Her customers come to her every day (from Monday until Sunday).  She will use her loan to buy supplies to make tortillas.  At the moment, her clients' orders have increased and she hasn't been able to meet all of their demands because she needs more capital to be able to produce more.

Luz Idalia's goal is for her daughters to graduate from school.

loans.use: to buy firewood, lime, corn, and water

loans.name: Ma. Concepcion

texts.en:
Ma. Concepcion works hard to support her family. She is married and has a selling of purified drinking water business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 6 years.

She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more purified drinking water to sell. Ma. Concepcion would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more purified drinking water to sell.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca earns a living selling RTW (ready-to-wear) clothes and Avon products to her community. She is 43 years old, married and has five school-aged children. Francisca's husband works as a fisherman.

Francisca has had her business for three years. She is able to help provide for her family's needs through her income. Francisca works hard to feed her family and send her children to school.

Francisca plans to use her loan to buy more clothes and Avon products to sell. She is hoping for this loan to help improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and Avon products to sell.

loans.name: Ruth Maria

texts.es: La señora Ruth llego de la ciudad de La paz desde muy temprana edad con nuevas perspectivas de vida junto a su familia, dedicándose al trabajo desde muy temprana edad donde solo llego a terminar el bachillerato y debido a la necesidad dejo a un lado sus planes de estudios es desde ahí que se puso a trabajar tiempo completo de ayudante de cocina de un restaurante de Quillacollo y que por factores de embarazo y las exigencias que había que cumplir dejo ese empleo hace 2 años y con los ahorros que tenía es donde decidió abrir este tipo de negocio, de librería, pensando en las necesidades que paso por la deficiencia de útiles escolares que tuvo en su niñez, Ella sola fue la que empezó su negocio con mucho sacrificio ya que tenía que atender a su familia a la misma vez. Ahora para ir consolidando este negocio es cuando quiere un préstamo para surtir su negocio y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Ruth came to the city of La Paz at a very young age with new perspectives on life, along with her family. She began to work at a very young age, and so, only continued her education long enough to graduate from high school. She left behind her plans to continue her studies because she needed to work full-time under a chef in a restaurant in Quillacollo. She left this job two years ago when she became pregnant. She decided to use some of her savings to open her own bookstore, remembering the lack of school supplies that she had as a girl. 

Ruth opened this business completely on her own, making many sacrifices and taking care of her family at the same time. Now, she is looking to strengthen her business and is requesting a loan to help her stock her store and get ahead.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Gulnura

texts.ru: Гульнура, 35 лет, замужем, есть сын. Образование у Гульнуры высшее. Она в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, занимается сельским хозяйством. Стартовав почти с нуля около 10 лет назад, на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Гульнуры есть 5 коров, 25 овец, 6 лошадей. Ежемесячная прибыль- около 21,000 сомов (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Гульнура планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.

loans.use: to purchase some livestock in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Itohan

texts.en: Mrs. Itohan E. a 33 years old started her food items business 4 years ago. She joined LAPO two years after she started her business with her little savings, lives in a semi-urban area of Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. She is eager to get the above amount for her business growth.

loans.use: To buy more food items for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She would like to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana L. is married, 32 years old and has 3 children. Her husband works harvesting coffee and she helps him. They sell their product to a wholesale merchant who processes it and puts it on sale in the market. But the income they receive for their work is very small, though they wish to give their children a better future. Juana would like to start a business with the loan money, where she would sell foodstuffs from her home, but in a way not to disrupt her family life. She belongs to the group Santa Catarina 11.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

JUANA L. ES CASADA, TIENE 32 AÑOS Y TRES HIJOS, SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN EL CAMPO CON LA COSECHA DE CAFÉ Y ELLA LE AYUDA, ELLOS SE LO VENDEN A MAYORISTAS QUIENES LO PROCESAN Y LO PONEN A LA VENTA EN EL MERCADO, PERO EL INGRESO FAMILIAR QUE ELLOS PERCIBEN ES MUY POCO YA QUE QUIEREN PARA SUS HIJOS UN MEJOR FUTURO. JUANA AHORA CON EL PRESTAMO QUIERE INICIAR UN NEGOCIO DE UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES EN SU CASA DE TAL FORMA QUE NO DESCUIDE SU HOGAR. ELLA PERTENECE AL GRUPO DE SANTA CATARINA 11.

loans.use: Drink and Snack Store

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en: Manuela

loans.use: Purchase corn and firewood to make tamales

loans.name: Teresa

texts.pt:
Teresa N. was born on November 20th, 1968, in the city of Maputo. She is married, mother of a 22 years old son. She was raised by her aunt in Vila Marinha, where she studied until the 8th grade. Teresa married in 1985 and moved to the city of Matola. There she started to work in a small business of selling bread and other baked goods from her front yard. She moved to Catembe in 1999, to the neighborhood of Chali. She worked as a maid for 10 years. She saved from her little income in order to start a used clothes business. Teresa was introduced to Hluvuku credit program through neighbors. With the loan of 11.000 MT, Teresa plans on buying used clothes, mattresses and beds to increase her inventory. Teresa’s work has a positive impact in her community because she is the only one selling that kind of product in her neighborhood. In the future she hopes to diversify her inventory to include children’s clothes, and furniture.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro Guachene- Catembe Cliente: Teresa N. Actividade:Comércio Valor de empréstimo: 11.000,00 MT (440.00US$) Aplicacao: Compra de roupa usada Início: 23/08/07 Fim: 14/12/08 Teresa N., nasceu a 20 de Novembro de 1968 em Maputo, casada maritalmente com 1 filho de 22 anos cresceu e viveu desde pequena com sua tia na Vila da Marinha onde estudou até 8ª classe. Casa-se em 1985 e foi viver na cidade da Matola e lá começa a desenvolver pequenos negócios de fabrico de bolos e pãezinhos que os vendia no seu quintal e também vendia comidas e bebidas. No entanto muda de residência passa a residir na Catembe em 1999 no bairro Chali e trabalha na cidade como empregada doméstica durante 10 anos e com pouco dinheiro que ganhava poupava algum e decide deixar de trabalhar e inicia o negócio de venda de roupa usada. Teve conhecimento da Hluvuku através de colegas e vizinhos os quais incentivaram-na a ter crédito como forma de melhorar seu negócio. Com o crédito de 11.000 MT pretende comprou fardos de roupa usada, colchões, camas. A actividade tem impacto pois no bairro é a única que vende este tipo de produto, e também diminui a distancia e tempo que tinham que percorrer para a cidade. O verão é tempo mais apropriado para venda de roupas e as mais preferidas são das crianças. No futuro almeja diversificar ainda amais sua actividade com enfoque para roupas para crianças e montar um estabelecimento para venda de cadeiras plásctica, camas, colchões.

loans.use: To increase stocks in business

loans.name: Doi Thi

texts.vi:
Since Mrs. Doi Thi L. has always been working hard as a fisherman, she looks older than other people at her age, 52. Before joining TYM Fund in 2003, she was always at sea, and only came home once in awhile. Thanks to TYM Fund, she can stay home to breed pigs and poultry. She also sells fish which her husband catches each time he comes ashore. Part of her loan from TYM Fund is spent towards fish net and other fishing tools. Her family income has significant increase. After subtracting the cost, her profit is about 50USD to 60USD. This time she would love to borrow 325USD to repair raft to catch fish.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Là người dân vùng biển, quanh năm đánh bắt hải sản trông chị Đới Thị Lưu già hơn tuổi 52. Thời gian trước chị cùng chồng thường xuyên đi biển ít khi về nhà. Sau khi tham gia Quỹ Tình thương vào năm 2003 chị nghỉ đi biển, ở nhà tập trung vào việc chăn nuôi lợn gà. Mỗi lần chồng đi biển về, chị lại mang số cá anh đánh được ra chợ bán. Nhờ vay vốn Quỹ gia đình đầu tư vào việc mua sắm lưới, dụng cụ đánh cá khiến thu nhập tăng lên. Mỗi tuần đi biển trừ chi phí gia đình thu lãi từ 50 USD đến 60 USD. Vòng vốn này chị đề nghị vay 325 USD để tiếp tục đầu tư cho chồng sửa sang bè đánh cá tiếp tục công việc làm ăn của gia đình.

loans.use: Repair raft to catch fish

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria del Socorro U. M. is 41, originally from the city of Bluefields. She is married to Francisco González and they have 2 children. Mrs. U. is the proprietor of a section of used clothing and has 3 years´ business experience. Her clients are men and women of all ages, with limited resources, who prefer to buy used clothing for their children from her because of the variety she offers. Mrs. U. would like to buy a parcel of used children´s clothing this month because of higher demand. The parcel costs US$300 and has 350 pieces. With this investment, she will be able to meet the demand.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. Maria del Socorro U. M. tiene 41 años de edad, es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields esta casada con el Sr. Francisco González ambos tienen 2 hijos. La Sra. U. es propietaria de un tramo de ropa usada, tiene 3 años de experiencia, sus clientes son mujeres y hombres de todas las edades, de escasos recursos que les compran ropa a sus hijos, que la prefieren por ofrecer variedad de ropa usada. La Sra. U. necesita comprar un paquete de ropa usada para niño porque en este mes hay mayor demanda, el paquete cuesta US$ 300.00 dólares y tiene 350 piezas, con esta inversión podrá satisfacer la demanda.

loans.use: Purchase a parcel of used children´s clothing.

loans.name: Solome's Group

texts.en:
Solome is a 45-year-old widow with four children. She is a poultry farmer and intends to use the extra profits she hopes to have from her expanded business to finish her poultry house that is under constuction.

She and her four friends, Yudaya, Noeline, Musazi, and Sauda, will each receive a share of this loan. Together they will support each other in the timely repayment of the loan. They each wish to improve their individual businesses so that they can better support their families.

loans.use: To expand her little poultry business and purchase  more birds to raise and chicken feed

loans.name: Parwen's Group

texts.en:
"I am a group leader and my name is Parween K.. I am married and live with my husband in a small town, Chichawatni, Pakistan. My brother is a rickshaw driver and he needs to replace his older rickshaw. I help him because he gives me a reasonable rate of profit out of his business.

Last year, I bought a sewing machine to start my stitching business with my share of his profits.

My group members are: Rukhsana B. who requires a loan for her flower business; Manzoora B. who will invest her share of our loan in her family’s envelope business; Shaheen Zulfiqar who wants a loan to improve their restaurant; and Rubina B. who will use the loan to expand their ready-made garment business.

loans.use: Replace older rickshaw with a new one

loans.name: Ndifakulya West A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Joy N.. She is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and is requesting a loan to invest in her business. Joy is 23 years old and is married. Her husband is a mechanic. She has 2 children ranging from age 4 to 8 and her children go to school. Each week, Joy makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy goats for rearing. Joy has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Joy is joined in her small group by Kamida N., Harriet N., Betty A., and Zaituni N.. Kamida N. has a business selling matooke and wants to purchase in bulk. Harriet N. is currently operating a restaurant business and wants a loan to purchase a fridge. Betty A. operates a business selling cabbages and wants to boost business. Zaituni N. is currently in the business of selling fish and is requesting a loan to add capital.

loans.use: To purchase more tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva is 30 years old. She is married to Angel Benitez, 32, who has worked as a driver for more than 20 years and helps pay for household expenses. They have one son, still a child, who lives with them.

She launched the business three years ago on her own initiative after realizing that there was no general store in the neighborhood. This helps explain why her sales have been so good and why she already has a loyal customer base.

Eva needs the loan to buy general merchandise like sugar, flour, yerba mate, rice, pasta, and bread.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Eva tiene 30 años de edad está casada con Ángel Benítez, de 32 años, quien trabaja como chofer hace más de veinte años, aportando para los gastos del hogar. Tienen un hijo, menor de edad que vive con ellos.

Inició el negocio hace tres años por iniciativa propia, percatándose de que no había una despensa en el barrio, lo cual ayuda a que las ventas sean muy buenas y ya cuenta con clientela formada.

Necesita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías en general como azúcar, harina, yerba, arroz, fideos, panificados y otros.

loans.use: Purchase of general merchandise: sugar, flour, yerba mate, rice, pasta, bread, etc.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is thirty eight years old and the mother of two children. One of the children is currently in school. She has been selling grocery products and cosmetics for four years now. She wants to use her loan to buy more products, because, as she reports, the products sells fast in the market and she needs to increase her inventory.

Millicent is a member of the group called "By His Grace." Members agree in principle to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics and grocery products.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy O. has been an LAPO member for the past four years. She is 46 years old, married and the mother of four children. She lives in Ibatedo in the state of Lagos in Nigeria. Since 1987, her business has been selling cooked food and drinks. Mercy needs the loan amount of $850 to enable her to buy more drinks and food items to sell.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and food items

loans.name: Thi Hang

texts.vi:
Mrs. N. Thi Hang is 30 years old. She has 3 school-going children. She joined the TYM Fund in 2000 and borrowed 1 million VND to invest in her clothes shop in the market. Even though the loan was small, it helped to increase her family's income as it was used effectively. Since then, she has borrowed increasing amounts to further invest in her clothes business. As she is friendly and charges reasonable prices, she gets more and more customers and so her family's income is increasingly stable. Beside the income from the clothes shop, her family also has additional income from her husband who is working as a driver. Therefore, her family's income is stable and her children can go to school. This time, she wants to borrow 19 millions VND (1,150USD) to purchase more clothes for the shop. Her family's average monthly income is 5 millions VND (about 322USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Hằng năm nay 30 tuổi. Hiện nay gia đình chị có 3 con đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Năm 2000 chị tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương và vay mức vốn 1.000.000 đ để đàu tư vào của hàng bán quần áo tại chợ. Với mức vốn tuy không lớn nhưng do biết cách sử dụng vốn hiệu quả nên thu nhập của gia đình chị đã được cải thiện. Đến nay qua 7 năm tham gia vào Quỹ với các mức vốn vay tăng dần chị đã đầu tư nhiều hơn vào của hàng quần áo của chị. Với giá bán hợp lý và thái độ luôn niềm nở của chị khách hàng đến với cửa hàng của chị ngày càng đông do đó thu nhập của gia đình chị ngày càng ổn định. Ngoài thu nhập từ việc kinh doanh quần áo, gia đình chị còn có thêm thu nhập từ công việc lái xe của chồng chị vì thế kinh tế gia đình chị ngày càng phát triển, các con của chị đều được ăn học đầy đủ. Vòng vốn tới chj mong muốn được vay thêm 19.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm hàng, quần áo để phục vụ cho khách hàng. Thu nhập bình quân 5.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Invest in clothes business

loans.name: Feruza

texts.en: M. Feruza became a client in 2008 and showed herself to be very responsible. She makes repayments to her loans on time and has had no problem following loan procedures. She lives in the Asht region of Tajikistan and she is 25 years old. Mrs. M. Feruza is engaged in trading home grown fruits and vegetables at the local bazaar. She is also a collective farmer. Mrs. Akbarova Gulnora applies to KIVA for a business support loan of 2100 STJ for 4 months in order to increase and improve her business.

loans.use: To improve and increase the business

loans.name: Mrs. Leak Lim's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This Village Bank which consists of twenty-eight people is located in Khsach Village in Kandal Province. Most of the members are married and they plan to use the loan in different purposes. For instance, Mrs. Leak L. is the village bank president and a vegetable seller in the local market. She will use her share of the loan to buy different kinds of vegetables to re-sell since this business activity is going well. Mrs. Leak L. is a widow with three children who are all employed in Naga Club which is a famous casino in Phnom Penh city, Cambodia. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan.

This is a village bank loan consisting partly of end-of-term loans. Three members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Three members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables for re-sale

loans.name: Bun

texts.en:
Mr. Bun I. is a villager in Trapaing Thom Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. He is 46 years old and the father of four children. One is a laborer making a dollar a day, another two attend the local school while the youngest is too young to work or study because he is just one year old. Mr Bun I. buys cow and then re-sells them at a better price. His wife, Mrs. Su Lorn, is a farmer who owns 1.5-hectares of farmland on which she cultivates rice.

Although Mr. Bun I. and his wife have two businesses between them, they still do not make enough to support their family well. In order to improve their living conditions, Mr. Bun Leng is requesting a loan to buy piglets to start a pig breeding business.

loans.use: To buy piglets to start a pig breeding business.

loans.name: Zinllahbodin

texts.en:
ZinllahboD., an educated and married man, has worked in agriculture for more than 10 years. With plenty of land available for cultivation, this hard-working man is requesting a loan to complete his stock and buy more seeds and ready his land for cultivation. ZinllahboD. is striving for success as a farmer to support his family and help build a better future for his children.

He would like to thank everybody supporting him and hopes to continue his partnership with both Kiva and AFSG in the years to come.

loans.use: To complete his stock and buy more seeds

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
A 23-year old Albert G. is a high-school graduate, married and a farmer/entrepreneur from Sto. South Cotabato. His wife stays at home to care for their one-year-old son. Married at young age, Albert learned to stand on his own in order to support the needs of his family by carefully tending the half-hectare rice field he inherited from his parents. To save labor costs, he manages his own rice field, were he earns his family's sole source of income.

Albert is applying for his second loan, which he will use to by fertilizer and pesticide for his rice field. “If I get this loan," he said, “I could maximize the yield of my farm, and with the extra money I earn, I will be able to send my son to school and finish a degree, a dream that I failed to achieve myself.”

Through his membership in CEV, Albert has not only generated savings, but also now has death insurance and a positive outlook on life. In meetings, he often talks about how the bible has inspired him to be courageous when trials come along his way.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide for a rice field.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en: Teopista N. is a 35 year old business woman. She is married with three school-going children. This hardworking lady owns a depot of soft drinks in Nateete. Running this business efficiently and effectively has enabled her set up a modern residential house where she resides with her family. She is using the loan to purchase a variety of sodas from various bottling companies. Her greatest aspiration at this moment in time is to accumulate some money and purchase a plot of land in one of the Kampala suburbs for the sole aim of constructing rental houses. With such an achievement, she looks forward to meeting her family needs comfortably.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of sodas from various bottling companies.

loans.name: Suong

texts.en:
Mrs. Suong P., 51, is a widowed farmer who lives with two of her children in Battambang province, Cambodia. She typically makes US$ 5 a day and is aided by two of her children who work as construction workers building houses.

Mrs. Suong P. would like to request a loan of US$ 500 to purchase a motorbike for her family transportation. This will reduce the cost that she and her children usually spend on public transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for family transportation

loans.name: Senablodo Petronille

texts.fr:
La signification d’ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique d’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux a 0% d’intérêt aux gens très vulnérables et il est dans un groupe qui lancent bientôt un programme de la microassurance santé. 
 
A. Z. Senablodo Petronille a 37 ans. Elle est scolarisée jusqu’au lycée. Petronille  a un enfant, Alvarex ; il a 10 ans et il va l’école.  Petronille vend les bijoux depuis 12 ans et les tissus depuis 10 ans. Petronille s’approvisionne a Lomé au Togo et au Marche Dantokpa, le plus grand marché de Cotonou, Benin. Le crédit lui a permis de répondre à ses besoins et les charges de son enfant. Dans l’avenir elle voudrait commencer par vendre en gros.
texts.en:
Ms. Senablodo Petronille A. Z., age 37, was educated through high school and has a son, Alvarex, who is 10 years old and in school. Petronille has been selling jewelry for twelve years and cloth for ten years. She gets her supplies in Lomé, Togo, and at the Dantokpa Market, the largest market in Cotonou, Benin. This loan will enable her to answer the needs and expenses of her child. In the future, she would like to start selling merchandise wholesale.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small country in West Africa, next to Nigeria, and it has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans at an interest rate of 0% to highly vulnerable people. It is part of a group that will soon launch a micro health insurance program.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth, jewelry, and shoes for resale

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua P. is 47 years old. She is a married woman with five children - two boys and three girls. She says one of her children is employed, another is currently in the university, and the rest are in the senior high and the primary schools. Akosua’s husband is a cocoa/poultry farmer. She lives with the family in a town called Dormaa Ahenkro in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Dormaa is an agricultural-dominated town. It is about a 45 minute drive from Sunyani, the regional capital. 

Akosua trades in fresh yams and crates of eggs to make some income. According to her, she procures the fresh yams and the eggs from Techiman and Kintampo where the price is quite economical. Akosua sells the yams on a table top in front of her house, mostly to retailers. She has been in business for ten years. Akosua wants a loan to increase her working capital so she can procure yams and eggs in bulk. She hopes to help her husband improve upon their standard of living and give all their children the best of education they can afford.

loans.use: To procure yams and eggs

loans.name: Fall's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Fall S. F. is the leader of a three-member borrowing group.  They all live in Norea Commune of Battambang Province.

Fall S. F., 49, earns a living by selling fish.  She usually gets up early each morning and buys different kinds of fishes wholesale and sell retail, to gain income.  She is married and has given birth to six children who attend school.  Her husband assists her in selling fishes. To enlarge her business and earn additional income, Fall S. F. is asking for a loan to increase her capital to buy more fishes to sell. 

The other two borrowers are: Yoeu S., 32, who sells fishes inside the market.  He requests a loan to buy fishes to sell.  Sin S., 34, is a motorcycle taxi driver.  He seeks for a loan to run a grocery store.

loans.use: To increase more her capital for buying fishes to sell

loans.name: Sherali

texts.ru: Курматов Шерали проживаю в районе Восе, поселок Гелот в возрасте 42-ух лет, женат имеет 7-ых детей.Имеет среднее образования, клиент занимается животноводством уже более 19 лет. Клиент покупает молодой скот, откармливает и перепродаёт.На полученные деньги, клиент хочет купить несколько молодых телят.Занимаясь этим видом деятельности содержит семью.
texts.en:
Sherali K. lives in the town of Gelot, in the Vose district. He is 42 years old, married and has seven children. He finished secondary school, and has raised livestock for more than 19 years. Sherali buys young cattle and fattens them for resale. With the money he will receive, he wants to purchase several young calves. By engaging in this sort of work he is able to support his family.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “LA AMISTAD”,  Está conformado por 14 miembros, todos ellos naturales del Cusco, y este banco se encuentra ubicado en el local principal de la Organización de bancos comunales ARARIWA.

Los socios se dedican a diferentes actividades, un porcentaje mayor tiene transporte público destinado a cubrir rutas dentro de la ciudad del Cusco, para lo cual solicitan el préstamo en razón de que necesitan comprar un seguro de vida para cada carro, otros miembros requieren el préstamo para poder comprar, barniz, pintura, arcilla, para elaborar artesanía, uno de ellos tiene el sueño de poder alquilar un día un local en la plaza central de Cusco y poder vender sus artesanías,  otras socias venden ropa que traen desde Bolivia, otra socia tiene un pequeño restaurante y solicitan el préstamo para poder implementar su negocio.

Los socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado y se comprometen en el pago de toda su deuda en el plazo determinado.
texts.en:
The community bank "La Amistad", is formed by 14 members, from Cusco. The bank is located at the principal location of the organization of banks ARARIWA. The members work on different activities, most of them work on public transportation that cover all the city of Cusco, this is why they request the loan because they need to buy car insurance for each vehicle, other members need the loan to buy paint and clay to create handicrafts. One of them has a dream of some day be able to rent a place at the central market in Cusco to sell his handicrafts, other members sell clothes that they bring from Bolivia, another member has a small restaurant and request the loan for her business. The members value and are thankful for the loan and commit to pay their debt on the time determined.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Public Transportation, handicrafts, clothes and other activities

loans.name: Cristina Primitiva

texts.es:
La señora Cristina es socia del Banco Comunal “Palomas de Oro” en el Distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, departamento de Puno, tiene 38 años de edad y es madre soltera de 03 hijos. Vive en el Barrio Cesar Vallejo, ella no tiene estudios. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 6 años, es socia fundadora. La actividad a la que se dedica es la compra y venta de chuño (papa procesada).  Su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles.

Con este préstamo de S/ 600.00 nuevos soles, comprará más chuño para luego venderlo en el mercado.
Su deseo es  comprar un puesto comercial de abarrotes y darle educación a sus hijos.

Asimismo ella refiere que le gusta mucho las reuniones de su Banco Comunal y la facilidad en los préstamos que da Manuela Ramos
texts.en:
Cristina is a member of the Palomas de Oro community bank in the Puno district, Puno province, Puno department. She is 38 and the single mother of three children. She lives in the Cesar Vallejo neighborhood. She does not have an education. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for six years. She is a founding member. She buys and sells chuño (freeze-dried potatoes). Her first loan was for 300 PEN. With this loan for 600 PEN she will buy more chuño to later sell in the market. Her wish is to buy a grocery stand and give her children a good education. She really likes her community bank meetings and the easy access to loans through Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chuño (freeze-dried potatoes)

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: Rosa R. is from the town of Katipunan, Sinacaban. She is 54 years old, married, and has three adult children. To make a living, Rosa is engaged in planting crops and selling produce such as corn, bananas, cassava, etc. Rosa earns approximately 1,200 PHP a month for these activities. In 2008, Rosa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rosa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. Rosa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer and pesticides. This loan will be her 2nd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Delfina Emperatriz

texts.es:
Delfina es socia del Bancomunal Mujeres Progresando.
Delfina  es casada tiene 42 años, dos hijos de 18 y 11 años,  que estudian en la escuela estatal
Delfina comenzó en el negocio vendiendo anticucho en la puerta de su casa, pero se dio cuenta que la salchipapa era más rentable y se puso a vender salchipapa por las noches, en el día trabaja en un salón de belleza.
Desde que Delfina esta en Finca su negocio pudo crecer y comprar mas mercadería, también pudo estudiar cosmetología.
Delfina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de licuadora, cerveza, gaseosas. 
El sueño de Delfina es poner una peluquería.
texts.en:
Delfina is a member of the Mujeres Progresando ("Progressing Women") Village Bank. Delfina is 42 years old and married with two children, who are 18 and 11 years old. Her children are currently studying in public schools. Delfina started out selling anticuchos (beef-heart kabobs) from her doorstep, but then realized that selling salchipapas (French fries with hot dog slices) would be more profitable, so she switched. Since joining FINCA, Delfina has been able to buy more merchandise and expand her business. She was also able to study cosmetology. Delfina needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy a blender, beer, and sodas. Delfina's dream is to open up a hair salon.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a blender, beer and sodas

loans.name: Anorhol

texts.ru: Мисирова Анорхол проживает в Варзобском районе. Возраст 63 года. Замужем, детей не имеет. Анорхол вместе с мужем занимается животноводством, т.к. пенсии им не хватает. Она откармливает и продает скот. Этим бизнесом занимается более 12 лет. Кредит, просит для покупки скота.
texts.en:
Anorhol M. lives in the Varzob district. She is 63 years old, married and has no children. Anorhol and her husband are involved in animal husbandry because pension is not enough to live on. She feeds and sells livestock. She has been involved in this business for over 12 years. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Martha Guadalupe

texts.es:
La señora Martha Guadalupe R. R. es Divorciada vive con una de sus hijas y cuenta con un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa usada, además de el negocio ella labora para una farmacia como intendente, con su negocio tiene 7 meses y mucha gente ya va a comprarle  ya que la ropa que vende es de muy buena calidad, solo que como no tiene suficiente capital para invertirle no ha lo ha surtido. 
Es por ello que llego a esta institución recomendad por otro cliente por que el apoyo que se daba era muy bueno y aparte le beneficiaria en sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Sra. Martha Guadalupe R. R. is divorced and lives with one of her daughters. She operates a small business selling used clothing. In addition, she works for a pharmacy as an administrator. She has been in business for 7 months, and many people buy from her because the clothes that she sells are of high quality. However, she does not have sufficient capital to invest in more merchandise.

For this reason, she has come to the institution on the recommendation from another client. She was told that she would be well supported and that she should see some benefit in her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: sale of charcoal

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad S. is 56 years old and lives in Amang Rodriguez Village, Concepcion, Marikina City. Her husband Celedonio, 61, is a retiree. They have two adult children.

Felicidad manages a home-based optical shop, providing eyeglasses and other eye-care services for vision-impaired individuals. She has been in this business for 30 years. She earns a net income of $400 a month.

She is asking for a loan in the amount of P15,000 in order to buy more frames for eyeglasses and optical supplies. She dreams of opening another optical shop soon. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To buy frames and lenses for eyeglasses

loans.name: Amavi

texts.fr: Cette femme est revendeuse des produits d’alimentation générale dans le quartier d’Ahadjikpoto à Lomé. Elle est mariée à un douanier et cette activité lui permet entre autre d’apporter sa contribution financière dans la gestion du foyer. Elle a débuté cette activité en 1982 ; c’est donc un secteur qu’elle maîtrise parfaitement à cause de la longue expérience déjà à son actif. Avec le temps, elle a pu détecter auprès de sa clientèle qu’elle pourra aussi se lancer dans la vente de tissus de différentes catégories, de bijoux et de perles. C’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter un bal de tissus ; le prêt servira également à acheter des perles et bijoux de qualités diverses. Par rapport au remboursement du prêt elle n’a aucune inquiétude pour cela. Elle est mère de 02 enfants.
texts.en:
This woman is a retailer of general food products in the Ahadjikpoto area of Lomé. She is married to a customs officer, and her business allows her, among other things, to contribute financially to the care of her family. She began this business in 1982; it is thus a field which she has mastered perfectly thanks to the length of experience already in her favour. With time, she was able to find out from her customers that she could also successfully sell different types of fabric, jewelry, and pearls. It is for this reason that she is seeking a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to buy a bale of fabric; at the same time, this loan will serve to buy pearls and jewelry of varying quality. Regarding the repayment of the loan, she has no worries. She is the mother of two children.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric and jewelry

loans.name: Harriet's Group

texts.en:
K. Harriet is the leader of her lending group in Kampala. She is 32 years old and married with two children aged 12 and 9 years. She also takes care of two orphans. She is a friendly and hardworking lady with a retail shop and a clinic as her businesses.

Harriet manages both businesses in two separate areas but is good at coordinating their functionalities. From the clinic, Harriet is able to make 100,000/= plus 70,000/= as profits from the retail shop per week. She has high hopes of having the best laboratory in her business area as well as having her children as role models in the community.

Harriet needs a loan to help increase stock both in the clinic and in the retail shop so that she could make more income. She is such a hardworking lady.

loans.use: To increase stock in both her retail shop and her clinic

loans.name: Glendy

texts.en:
Glendy D. R. is from the village of D. Carmen Iligan City. She is 20 years old. Glendy is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Glendy sells "RTW" clothing in the local community. Glendy has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities. (Picture was taken at the store of Monica Dela Cerna)

In 2009, Glendy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Glendy is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase more items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Glendy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more items to expand product offering

location.town: Del Carmen, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: John

texts.en: John G., 31 years old, has two primary businesses: a cell phone kiosk and transportation for hire with his pick-up truck. He operates out of a market setting in Kangemi town, and his kiosk offers "top-off' cards for cell phones, M-Pesa payment capabilities as well as other cell phone accessories. In addition to his two businesses, John has a garden where he grows cash crops of maize, beans and potatoes. His business challenges are security for the kiosk and a lack of funds for expansion.  John is using his loan of KES 20,000 to increase his working capital. His business goals are to concentrate on M-Pesa and to purchase more vehicles for tranportation.  John has a wife, who works with him at the kiosk, and one child.  He describes himself as hardworking and he serves as the treasurer of his borrowing group, Carnivore 2009.

loans.use: Increase working capital.

loans.name: Ven

texts.en: Mr. Ven N. is a villager in Thnuoh village in Takeo province.  Mr. Ven N. is 55-years old. He and his wife have five children, two work in a garment factory, one is a farmer, and the other two are enrolled in the local school. He owns a poultry business, and his wife, Mrs. Non Srey, is a farmer who owns a small plot of land where she cultivates rice. She is requesting a loan to buy 500 ducks and duck food for breeding for the poultry business. This will expand the business and increase their income.

loans.use: To purchase 500 ducks for breeding and duck food

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria S. is from the city of Capatan Tuguegarao City. She is 49 years old. Victoria is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Victoria provides manicure and pedicure services in the local community. Victoria has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Victoria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Victoria is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Victoria from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Tchilalo

texts.fr:
Cette femme exerce comme activité la vente de boissons locales alcoolisées appelées "Toucoutchou" qui est faite à base de mil et est très appréciée par les togolais,elle a plus de 7 ans d’expérience dans ce commerce ce qui fait qu’elle est très connue et a une parfaite maîtrise de son activité. Elle s’approvisionne en mil à l’intérieur du pays  plus précisément dans la ville d’anié et de kara. Voulant se réapprovisionner en mil parce que son stock de mil épuisé, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de  20 sacs de mil.
Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants.
texts.en:
This woman sells a local alcoholic drink known as "Toucoutchou," made from millet and much appreciated by Togolese people. She has been in this business more than seven years, is well known and an expert in what she does. She buys millet in central Togo, specifically in the towns of Anie and Kara. She wishes to buy more because her stock is depleted. She is asking for a loan from WAGES to buy 20 sacks, She is married and has six children.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy millet.

loans.name: María Margarita

texts.es:
María es una madre de familia de 40 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y sus cuatro hijos en el sector Licapa del distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicado a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace cinco años tiene instalada en su casa una pequeña bodega en donde ofrece a sus clientes productos de primera necesidad (arroz, azúcar, aceite), abarrotes, bebidas y golosinas. Ella nos comenta que la idea de su negocio nació debido a que los ingresos que su esposo percibe como trabajador eventual no eran suficientes para solventar los gastos familiares.

El negocio de María tiene buena acogida debido a la calidad de trato que brinda a sus clientes. Ella está pensando en ampliarlo con la compra de más mercadería, pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción, por ese motivo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el logro de su objetivo.

Su más grande anhelo es ampliar poco a poco su negocio para hacer mejoras en su vivienda. Ella es una mujer responsable, amable y muy trabajadora.
texts.en:
María is the mother of a family. She is 40 years old and lives together with her husband and 4 children in the Licapa sector, Paiján district, Ascope province, La Libertad region, located 3 hours from the city of Chiclayo. For 5 years she has a small grocery store in her house where she offers her customers essential items (rice, sugar, oil), grocery items, drinks and lollies. She told us that the idea for her business was born owing to the fact that her husband's earnings weren't sufficient to cover the household costs. María's business is well-known owing to the quality that she tries to give her customers. She is thinking about expanding with the purchase of more products, but doesn't have sufficient capital to realise this action, and for this reason for the first time she is seeking a loan of 1500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternative, which she is thinking of using to achieve her objective. Her greatest wishi is to little by little expand her business to make improvements to her house. She is a very responsible woman, friendly and very hard-working.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products for local store

loans.name: Luz Yanet

texts.es:
Luz tiene 27 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus padres en el sector Prada del distrito de Motupe, ubicado a hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la costureria desde hace cinco años, estudió la carrera de corte y confección en un instituto de la ciudad de Chiclayo y cuando terminó sus estudios instaló en su vivienda un pequeño taller donde atiende los pedidos que le hacen sus habituales clientes. Paralelamente también confecciona ropa de manera independiente y la ofrece en venta.

Ella se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de más material (telas e hilos) para ampliar su negocio, ya que la calidad con la que elabora su trabajo ha hecho que se haga conocida en la zona y que siempre tenga clientes solicitando sus servicios.

Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria y hacer crecer su taller. Esta es la segunda vez que Luz trabaja con nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Luz is 27 years old, single and lives together with her parents in sector Prada, Motupe district, situated about and 1.5 hours away from Chiclayo.

She has been a seamstress for 5 years and studied confeccion and styling at an insitute in Chiclayo. When she finished her studies, she built a small shop on the side of her house where she attends the requests of her clients. In parallel to this, she makes clothes to order and offers them for sale.

She is soliciting a loan from Edpyme Alternative for 1500 nuevos soles that she thinks she will use in the purchase of more material (cloth and string) to grow her business. The quality with which she has done her busines has made her well known in the area and has customers who solicit her services.

Her wish is to continue to grow as a business woman and to grow her business. This is the second time that Luz worked with our insititution and she has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility when taking on debt.

Translated from Spanish by karl baumgarten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth and string to grow her business

loans.name: Carlos  Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Carlos C. se dedica a la actividad de sastrería en el departamento de Chinandega donde ha adquirido amplia experiencia en dicha labor y ha logrado satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes por medio de la elaboración de las piezas que a él le solicitan.
Es de importancia destacar que él se ha dedicado a esta actividad desde hace 35 años y de aquí ha logrado generar los ingresos para su hogar. Solicita el crédito para ser invertido en la reparación de la máquina de coser ya que ha estado dañada pero al repararla continuará brindando a sus clientes un buen servicio por ser un sastre muy destacado en su localidad.
texts.en:
Carlos C. works as a tailor in the Chinandega district, where he has earned ample experience in this type of labor. He has managed to satisfy the needs of his customers by making items that they request. It’s important to highlight that he has dedicated himself to this activity for 35 years and that, through this means, he has managed to generate income to support his family. He is requesting this loan to invest into repairing a sewing machine that is broken. Once it is fixed, he will continue to provide his customers with the excellent service they are accustomed to, and that he is known for throughout his locality.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair a sewing machine.

loans.name: Jakhongir

texts.ru: Муратов Джахонгир проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст, 30 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам клиент зарабатывает путём разведения скота. Имеет небольшой коровник. Он покупает скот, откармливает и продает. Это помогает ему обеспечивать семью. Кредит берет для закупа скота. Именно сейчас покупка скота может быть выгодна, так как зимою животные исхудавшие и продаются по низким ценам. Он хочет приобрести корову и продать на рынке по более выгодной цене.
texts.en:
Jakhongir M. lives in the Shahrituz region. He is 30 years old, married and has four children. His wife takes care of the household, while Jakhongir works in animal husbandry. He owns a medium-size cow shed. He purchases livestock, raises it and sells it. This income helps him look after his family. He is applying for a loan in order to purchase cattle. This time of the year is a favorable time to purchase animals, because over the winter cattle tend to lose weight and therefore command a lower price. He would like to purchase a cow and then sell it at the market at a higher price.

Translated from Russian by Irina Chakraborty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann R. is 46 years old and lives in the town of Suay.  She is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To make a living, Mary Ann buys and sells fish.  She has a small sugar cane plantation as well.  When she and her husband, Jose, first started their fishing business, she did not have enough money for a boat.  With the help of Project Dungganon, she was able to buy a boat, allowing the family to earn much more.  Mary Ann has been engaged in this business for more than 22 years.  From these activities, Mary Ann earns approximately PHP 10,000 a month.

In 2002, Mary Ann joined NWTF to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She is now requesting a new loan of PHP 19,000, to invest in expanding her business.  She needs to repair her fishing boat and to invest in her sugarcane plantation.  The loan will be the 12th loan she has taken out \from NWTF.  Mary Ann plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition fees and to repair her house.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than  $1 a day to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To repair her fishing boat and plant sugarcane

loans.name: Neth

texts.en: Neth C., age 49, is married and resides with her children in Daoun Keo District, Takeo province, Cambodia. She has two children. She is engaged in growing rice and raising pigs, earning an income of USD 1.50 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband (pictured) who sells palm wine, earning an income of USD 2.50 per day. Their standard of living has improved since they have had these businesses. Neth C. is requesting a loan of 600 USD to purchase a motorbike for the family to use. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Kwapong Group

texts.en:
Francisca is forty years old. She is a married woman and has given birth to four children who are between the ages of two and eighteen years. She lives with her husband, who trades in clothes, and the children in a rented apartment in their community. 

Francisca is a hard-working woman. She trades in dried fish. She has been in business for sixteen years and has acquired a great deal of experience. Francisca buys the fish from nearby towns. She is hoping to be a wholesaler of dried fish in her community. She also aspires to give all her children a very good education as a legacy.

Francisca is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Kwapong’ (the name of the community where they reside). The group is made up of seven members and they are mainly traders. They are requesting a loan to procure goods in bulk to scale up their businesses.

loans.use: to buy fish in bulk for resale

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia pertenece al banco comunal “SAYHUA” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 29 años, es natural de la ciudad Urubamba y tiene un hijo. Ya es un año y medio que participa en el banco comunal.

Su principal actividad económica es vender ropa en el Centro Comercial "Señor de Sidrachayoc" de la ciudad de Urubamba. Ya son dos años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  Ella requiere el crédito para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo chompas, camisas, polos y muchas cosas más. 
 
Julia es una mujer trabajadora que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario dar un mejor futuro a su hijo. El anhelo de la socia es tener su propia tienda de ventas de ropas. 

Julia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Julia has been a member of the communal lender “Sayhua” of the Arariwa Association for the past year and a half. She is 29 and lives in the city of Urubamba with her son. Julia's principal economic activity is selling clothing in the "Señor de Sidrachayoc" shopping center in Urubamba. She has managed this business for the past two years and has seen sales prosper through her efforts. She seeks a loan to buy varied clothing such as jackets, shirts, sports clothing and other marketable items. Julia is a hard worker that is constantly seeking opportunities to get ahead and offer a better future for her son. Her goal is to one day have her own clothing store. She is very grateful for the opportunity that micro-lending represents, and she is committed to paying off the loan in the timeframe specified.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Cassetta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Additional stock of marketable clothing items

loans.name: El Cruce Hacia El Futuro (Cuenca) (Crossroad Toward The Future) Group

texts.es:
El Cruce hacia el Futuro es un banco comunal que  está formado por un grupo de mujeres que buscan cada día mejor la economía de su hogar con su trabajo diario, se encuentra ubicado en la parroquia Sinincay localidad donde podemos disfrutar de sus campos verdes y floridos, la frondosa vegetación de sus  montañas, sus ríos y quebradas, el trino de sus aves, sus casas de adobe y ladrillo mezcla de lo antiguo con lo moderno, su gente se caracteriza por su humildad, trabajo, respeto a los demás y  amabilidad con los visitantes. 

La señora Mónica C. vive en el barrio Las Malvinas en la ciudad de Cuenca, se encuentra en su primer crédito motivada por su tía y prima a formar parte de este hermoso grupo de mujeres combatientes en la vida, tiene 34 años de edad, se encuentra separada hace 12 años de su esposo ya que el viajo hacia el extranjero para brindarles un mejor futuro pero al  llegar a su destino se olvido de su familia, en su unión conyugal ha concibió  una hija que se encuentra de 11 años de edad y estudia en una escuela de la ciudad, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus padres.

Mónica es empleada privada pero  también labora en un bar de su mamá que  por el momento se esta haciendo cargo ya que su progenitora se encuentra enferma, en él   trabaja solo los fines de semana y en sus tiempos libres se dedica a la venta de ropa actividad que la realiza hace 3 meses.

Con su crédito comprará pantalones, camisas, blusas, faldas, vestidos y mas prendas para toda la familia para de esta manera contar con un stock surtido  para su exigente clientela.

Su mayor sueño es tener una casa propia.

La señora Rosa P. vive en el sector El  Cruce de Sinincay, tiene 44 años de edad, se encuentra casada y fruto de su unión conyugal engendró seis  hijos quienes se encuentran de 27, 25, 22, 14, 13 y 4 años de edad, su primera hija es casada y vive de manera independiente, su segundo hijo trabaja en  Hidropaute y solo llega a su casa los fines de semana y es quien le ayuda un poco con la economía de su hogar, su tercer hijo trabaja y  estudia en la universidad, sus dos hijos siguientes estudian en el colegio, su esposo es de profesión albañil y  gracias al  sacrificio  familiar  han logrado construir su casa propia.
