Rosa antes contaba con un kiosco en el cual sacrificaba  chanchos y preparaba unos ricos platos pero hace un año y medio se enfermo de la vesícula y tuvo que dejar esta actividad, ahora trabaja en el  bar de un colegio en el que se  encuentra ocho  meses.

Es socia del banco comunal hace diez  años gracias  a la invitación de su prima, con  los créditos anteriores mantenía su kiosco y hoy  con su nuevo crédito pagará  unas deudas adquiridas en su anterior negocio que se le han acumulado.

Su meta es mejorar el estado  de su vivienda.
texts.en:
El Cruce Hacia el Futuro (Crossroads Toward the Future) is a communal bank that was formed by a group of women who look every day to improve their household economy through daily work. The group is located in the Sinincay neighborhood where you can enjoy green and flowered fields, the lush vegetation of the mountains, the rivers and brooks, the song of the birds, adobe and brick houses both traditional and modern. The people are known for their humility, work, respect for others, and friendliness toward visitors. Señora Mónica C. lives in the neighborhood of Las Malvinas in the city of Cuenca. She is requesting her first loan, motivated by her aunt and her cousin to form part of this splendid group of women striving in life. She is 34 years old and has been separated from her husband for 12 years since he left the country to try and offer them a better future, but on arriving at his destination he forgot about his family. Their union had resulted in a daughter who is now 11 years old and studies in a school in the city. Monica does not have her own house so she lives in her parents' house. Monica works as a domestic servant and also works in her mother's bar. For the moment she is in charge since her parent has been sick. She works at the bar only weekends and in her free time she works selling clothing which she has been doing for 3 months. With this loan she will buy pants, shirts, blouses, skirts, dresses, and other accessories for all family members in order to have a ready stock of items for her demanding clients. Her greatest dream is to have her own house. Señora Rosa P. lives in the El Cruce de Sinincay area, is 44 years old, and is married. Her marriage has resulted in six children who are ages 27, 25, 22, 14, 13, and 4. Her oldest daughter is married and lives independently. Her second son works in Hidropaute and only comes to the house on weekends. He helps Rosa a little with the economy of the home. Her third son works and studies at the university. The 2 next children continue studying in high school. Her husband is a professional mason. Thanks to the sacrifice of the family they have been able to build their own house. Rose had a stand where she butchered pigs and prepared rich dishes but a year and a half ago she got a gallbladder illness and had to give up that work. Now she works in the cafe of a high school where she has been for eight months. She has been a member of the communal bank for 10 years, thanks to an invitation from her cousin. With previous loans she maintained her stand and with the new loan she will pay some debts acquired in her previous business that have accumulated. Her goal is to improve the state of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pants, shirts, blouses, skirts, dresses, and other clothing for all family members.

loans.name: Nguyen

texts.en: Nguyen T. D. was born in 1963. She lives in Ha Lam village. She not only grows rice but also raises pigs. Her husband died. She is very hard working. She has a monthly income of about 2,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). She has two girls. One of them is married. Mrs. Nguyen has participated in SEDA since 2004 and has repaid loans punctually. She likes pay loans weekly because it is easier for her to save money. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to buy more pigs.

loans.use: To buy pigs

loans.name: Sope Serigne Mourtalla/ndoffene Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de Solidarité "SOPE SERIGNE MOURTALLA" est créé en 2007, au jour d'inauguration du Banc Villageois de NDOFFENE2 (son Banc Villageois de tutel). Il est composé de 15 femmes toutes issues du même village, elles sont en moyenne âgée d’une trentaine d’années et  sont  mariées et mères d'au moins de 3 enfants. Les membres suivants Mbène T., Fatou D., Binta T., Fatou F., Seynabou N., Daba Codou D., Awa F. et Sophie S. viennent de faire leur entrée dans le groupe, elles en sont à leur premier cycle. Elles ont formé leur groupe de solidarité par affinité et elles se réunissent régulièrement pour discuter de la bonne organisation de  leur affiliation. La zone où est implanté le Banc Villageois est très propice au commerce a cause des marchés hebdomadaires ce qui facilite les femmes à mener des activités commerciales telles l'embouche bovines et/ou ovine, le petit commerce, la transformation et vente d'huile d'arachide, de vente de poissons frais etc. Ce faisant, la plus part des femmes du village se sont adonnée a des activités lucratives. Et ce nouveau crédit leurs permettra d'augmenter leur niveau d'autofinancement afin de mieux développer leur commerce et embouche.

Madame Khémesse F., debout à l'extrême droite de la photo portant à la taille un pagne blanc pour le port de son bébé au dos est âgée 23 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants en charge. Elle est vendeuse de céréales locales et d’arachides, elle sillonne les marchés hebdomadaires des environs pour écouler son produit. Son objectif est de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille tout en renforçant son niveau d’épargne.
texts.en:
The solidarity group "SOPE SERIGNE MOURTALLA" was created in 2007 on the inauguration day of the Banc Villageois of NDOFFENE2 (the trustee). The group is composed of fifteen women, all from the same village, who average 30 years of age and who are married mothers of at least three children each. The following members, Mbène T., Fatou D., Binta T., Fatou F., Seynabou N., Daba Codou D., Awa F., and Sophie S. have just joined the group and are on their first (loan) cycle. They formed their solidarity group by affinity and meet regularly to discuss the right way to organize their affiliation. The area where the Banc Villageois is established is very favorable to commerce due to the weekly markets which faciliate the women's businesses, such as the fattening of cattle and/or sheep, small-scale commerce, the production and sale of peanut oil, the sale of fresh fish, etc. Given this, most of the women of the village are devoting all their time to lucrative work. And this new loan will enable them to increase their level of self-financing in order to develop their businesses further. Ms. Khémesse F. (standing at the far right in the photo and wearing a white pagne cloth at her waist for carrying her baby on her back) is 23 years old and the married mother of three children to support. She is a seller of local grains and peanuts. She criss-crosses the weekly markets in the area to sell her produce. Her goal is to help improve her family's living conditions while boosting her saving.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering the business initiatives of the solidarity group

loans.name: God With Us Group

texts.en:
Princess K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called God With Us. She is 34 years old, is single, and has three children who range from 1 to 18 years old. She also cares for two siblings. Princess was only able to attend school through 11th grade due to lack of financial support.

For six years, Princess has been selling rice, bitter-boy, pepper and oil in ELWA Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more bags of rice, bitter-boy, pepper and gallons of oil.

Princess describes herself as peaceful. Her goal is to improve her business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, bitter-boy, pepper and gallons of oil

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene P. is from the village of Capellan. She is 31 years old, married and has 1 school-aged child. Irene owns & operates a general store where she sells a variety of products. Irene has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Irene joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Irene is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Irene from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Bun

texts.en: Mrs. Bun R. is a 58-year-old married woman. She currently resides in an average house with other family members. Bun R. grows crops on her own farmland in the village. Her husband frequently works in the fields alongside her. Bun R. is the mother of three children, almost all of whom are of legal age. Her children currently work at different occupations. Bun R.’ children face difficulty traveling to their work locations because they don’t have a vehicle for commuting. To solve the problem, Bun R. decided to purchase a second-hand motorbike using the loan she has requested. (Mrs. Bun R. was not available when the photo taken, so her husband is pictured instead.)

loans.use: To purchase a second-hand motorbike

loans.name: Silvia Elena

texts.es:
Silvia se dedica al comercio desde hace varios años, impulsada por financiamiento de Afodenic, el cual a través de los préstamos ha logrado el crecimiento de su pequeño negocio una pulpería en donde vende una variedad de productos, a si como frutas y verduras.
Para lograr otros ingresos hace nacatamales los fines de semanas, ya que por su salud gasta mucho en medicamento ya que es diabética, no ha sido fácil, cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijo y su  esposo, el cual trabaja como albañil.
Su necesidad es poder reparar el techo de su vivienda ya que se le esta pasando el agua y no cuanta con el dinero suficiente para la reparación a si como la compra de dos puertas para mejorar las condiciones de seguridad de su familia.
texts.en:
Thanks to loans from Afodenic Silvia has been a merchant for several years. The loans have helped her small grocery store, where she stocks a variety of products as well as fruits and vegetables, to grow. To earn extra income she makes nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamales popular as weekend fare) on the weekend because, being diabetic, she spends a lot on medicines. It hasn’t been easy for her but she can count on help from her children and her husband, who works as a bricklayer. She needs to repair her roof because it’s leaking and she lacks the necessary funds to do so. She also needs to buy two doors to improve her family’s security.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies for roof repair and to buy two doors.

loans.name: Ruth Y Esther 2 Group

texts.en:
Andrea is the coordinator of her group, Ruth y Esther 2. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her two children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to have a stable business. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying work.

Andrea is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for two years, starting with selling underwear. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying shoes, accessories, underwear and an exhibitor. She will use the profits to buy school supplies, to invest in more products, and she is planning to buy a computer. She also wants to have telephone service and to have a store with all kinds of merchandise.

This Esperanza associate began with us because she needed the loan for her business. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in Samana, a lush rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy underwear and shoes

loans.name: Chinbat

texts.en:
Chinbat R. is a modest, open-minded man. He is 31 and lives with his wife and son in Huvsgul province, Mongolia, in their own fenced ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent. His son, Batzolboo, attends a local secondary school while his wife is currently unemployed.

Chinbat has been operating a mobile phone business in a rented store space for ten years and now has some clients. He purchases mobile phones and tools by himself. He hired his sibling as a salesperson at his stall.

Chinbat wishes to expand the business and own his shop. He is requesting a 3,600,000 MNT loan to purchase mobile phones and spare parts in order increase his sales.

loans.use: To purchase mobile phones and spare parts

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 48 year old married man. He has one wife and four children. The gentleman got introduced to KADET LIMITED by a credit officer of the company. 

Currently, Moses operates a retail shop whereby he is the sole proprietor of the business. The shop is five years old and is situated in Maweni Malindi town and the main customers are mostly Malindi town dwellers. This is the third time that Moses is being served with a loan from KADET LIMITED. This loan is for KES80,000. He plans to use a big portion of the loan to add stock to his business and the rest of the loan to repair his place of work.

Moses wishes to use the anticipated profit coming from the business to educate his children and continue looking after his family. He also dreams that one day he may get to expand his business and perhaps own a supermarket.

loans.use: To add more stock to the business and to repair his place of work.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda B. is from the village of Jampason, Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 47 years old, married and has 7 school-aged children. Nilda owns & operates a business venture, making and selling homemade honey in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Nilda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Nilda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Seema's Group

texts.en:
Seema has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her embroidery business. With the loan, she will buy embroidery items such as cloth, beads, colored thread and sketches in bulk quantity to fill larger orders on time. She is a very talented lady, involved in her embroidery business for over 15 years. She mainly gets orders from her neighborhood clients. By the grace of God, in these years she has successfully maintained her reputation among her customers through her quality work and fulfilling her commitments.  
 
She is married to A. A. who is a daily wage labor. She has a daughter and a son. Both are illiterate and do different work. Her daughter does embroidery and her son has a business of leather selling. She lives with her family in Kasur which is a mid-sized city of Pakistan and known for its leather industry. She owns a two-room brick house where she has been living for over 20 years.  

She is hopeful that she will be able to make more income after this loan investment which will result in making her family’s lifestyle better. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has proved a responsible client who has paid her installments on time and attended every meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) in her hands is Seema.

loans.use: To buy embroidery items for embroidery business

loans.name: Kham

texts.en: Kham K. is 50 years old and a humble villager living in the capital, Phnom Penh, in the middle of Cambodia. He is married and blessed with six children. His wife (pictured) is a farmer who also raises a few pigs behind her house for additional profit. To earn a living, Kham K. distills alcohol. He often receives an order from villagers who lives next and around his house when they need alcohol for celebrating wedding parties or ceremonies. Kham K. is concerned that he is hardly ever able to travel anywhere except by walking. Kham K. dreams of having a vehicle but he doesn’t have money to buy one. Therefore, Kham K. is requesting a loan to purchase a new motorcycle for his traveling.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle for traveling.

loans.name: Shahida Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Shahida Perveen is a resident of Multan, which is an historic city in Pakistan known for its history and sweetmeat. She has been living there in a two-room brick house with her family for over 18 years. She is a very supportive wife and a caring mother. She is raising her children with great care. She is married to M. A. and has given birth to three children. Her elder son works in a motor workshop as a motor mechanic and her other two children are enrolled in school and getting their education. 

Her husband works as a janitor at a company for a meager income and she supports her family financially by operating a selling clothes business. She is also an embroidery expert who creates beautiful handmade embroidery designs on clothes and sells to the clothing shops at a good profit. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her clothes selling business. With the loan, she will buy a larger quantity of clothes from the wholesale markets and increase her sales. She is very confident that an investment will definitely help her business grow further and she will be able to provide better facilities of life to her family. 

She is a new loan user of Asasah and hopes it will be a long term relationship.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.es: El señor Sebastián  es transportista propietario de un automóvil pequeño que trabaja como Minibús en un  sindicato,   lleva en esta actividad 27 años, El Sr.  Sebastián vive junto a su esposa y a su hijo , su esposa para poder solventar sus gastos familiares  se dedica a la venta de comida puesto que en el lugar donde viven se encuentra la parada de una línea de micros, don Sebastián y su esposa con muchos esfuerzo lograron comprar una casa, actualmente se encuentra en construcción, por eso es que solicitan el crédito, para cubrir los costos de la mano de obra y la compra de material de construccion, El Sr. Sebastián solicita por segunda vez crédito en la institución demostrando responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus pagos.
texts.en: Sebastián is the driver of a small car that he owns, and he works as a microbus taxi driver in a labor union.  He has been in this business for 27 years.  Sebastian lives with his wife and their son.  In order to pay the family expenses, his wife sells food.  Since in the place where they live, there is a stop for the microbus taxi line, with a lot of effort Sebastian and his wife managed to buy a house that is currently under construction.  They are requesting the loan to cover the costs of the labor and the purchase of construction materials.  Sebastian is requesting his second loan from the institution and will demonstrate responsibility and punctuality in his payments.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Harutyun

texts.en:
Harutyun G. is 45 years old. He lives in Tsovagyugh village in the Sevan area with his wife and his grown-up son. 

Harutyun is a cook and from 1984 until 1997, he worked on the Sevan lake coastal strip’s different cafés as a cook. Since 1997, Harutyun and his family have been engaged in animal breeding. On their farm, they have cows, sheep, goats, pigs and chickens that they rear on their own small plot of land.
 
Harutyun is asking for a 600,000 Armenian Dram loan to buy five calves for his farm, which will allow him to increase his family’s income in the near future. 

This is Harutyun’s second loan from Nor Horizon, and he made his repayments without delay.

loans.use: To buy five calves for his farm

loans.name: Jader Antonio

texts.es: Jader de 30 años de edad es casado, tiene 2 hijos, el mayor de 5 añitos y el menor de 2 meses de edad, labora para ENACAL como fontanero desde hace 10 años. Esta solicitando su  8vo credito con el objetivo de mejorar su propia casa, pues acaba de pasarse y necesita acondicionar la cocina y los cuartos, ya que necesita que sus hijos esten en un ambiente confortable que le permitan desarrollarse mejor. Cabe señalar que Jader ha utilizado sus creditos para ir mejorando poco a poco su pequeña casita, pues es el patrimonio de sus hijos.
texts.en: Jader, 30 years old, is married and has two children; the older one is five years old and the younger one is two months old. He has worked for ENACAL as a plumber for 10 years. He is requesting his eighth loan to improve his own home. He needs to renovate the kitchen and the rooms because he needs for his children to have a comfortable place where they can grow up well. Note that Jader has used his loans to improve his small home little by little for his children's sake.

loans.use: Renovate kitchen and rooms

loans.name: Edis

texts.es:
En la parroquia Quiroga de la  ciudad de Calceta, localidad donde la gente se dedica en gran parte a la agricultura, cría de animales  y a la venta de sus productos, se reúne cada quince días  El Banco Comunal Quiroga.

La señora Edis  es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en  otros lugares. Tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 6 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad pero tres aun viven con ella. Su esposo es comerciante.

Es una gran ama de casa que realiza los créditos para ayudar a su esposo en el negocio, el se dedica a la compra y venta de gallinas y otras aves de corral, trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 12h00,  los viernes y sabados que es cuando más vende hasta las 16h00, ella también se dedica a la cría de gallinas y otras aves de corral que su esposos también lleva  vender cuando están para la venta.

Este crédito es para comprar gallinas, pavos, pollos pequeños para la cría y alimentos para los mismos. Sus sueños son tener una gran granja de pollos y espera que pronto se realice.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the Quiroga Community Bank meets in Quiroga parish, in the city of Calceta.  Most people here work in crop farming, livestock farming and sales.

Edis is a founding member of her community bank and she likes the bank because its interest rates are lower than elsewhere.  Edis is 54 years old, married, and has 6 grown-up children.  Three of her children still live with her.  Her husband is a salesman.

Edis is a great housewife who requests loans to help her husband in his business buying and selling hens and other poultry.  He works every day from 6.00am to 12.00p0m.  Fridays and Saturdays are when he makes most sales, working until 4.00pm.  Edis also raises hens and other poultry that her husband takes to sell when they are ready.

This loan will be used to buy hens, turkeys and chicks to raise, and also animal feed.  Edis' dream is to own a large poultry farm and she hopes that she will soon realize this dream.

loans.use: To buy hens, turkeys and chicks, and animal feed

loans.name: Marie Louise

texts.en:
Marie louise is 32 years old and is married, with 3 children aged between 7 and 12 years.  For 3 years, Marie louise has been running a shop that sells African cloth. The shop is open from 7am until 5pm every day except on the weekend, and employs one other person.

Marie louise will use her loan to purchase more cloths and also to reinvest in her business. With any profits, Marie louise will have savings in the future.

loans.use: To buy more African cloths to sell

loans.name: Bismar Antonio

texts.es:
Bismar casado, su esposa es comerciante, tiene un niño pequeño, el cliente considera mejorar la sala de su vivienda, profesión agricultor se le ha presentado problema de falta de financiamientos para salir adelante. Inicio desde muy joven a trabajar la tierra con el apoyo de su suegro. Planes para su negocio es establecer vives en los perímetro de la finca.
 Con el préstamo comprara insumos, fertilizantes y abonos para la aplicarse en la tierra y obtener una mejor cosecha siendo vendida a mejor precio. Agradece a la financiera por su apoyo al desarrollo de su finca.
texts.en:
Bismar is married. His wife is a saleswoman and they have a young son. He wishes to make improvements to his living room. He works in agriculture and has been struggling with the lack of financial capital to get ahead. He began working the land at a very young age with the help of his father in law. He wants to grow crops around the perimeter of his land.

With the loan, he will buy fertilizer for his land to obtain a better crop that will be sold for a better price. He is thankful for the lender for their support of his farm's development.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Misael

texts.es:
Don Misael, tiene 55 años de edad, vive con su esposa y una cuñada, residen en Usulután; don Misael se dedica a la ganadería, este negocio lo inicio por el apoyo de amistades que son ganaderos, trabaja junto a su esposa, no tiene un horario fijo para realizar los quehaceres de la ganadería, cuenta con experiencia en la actividad.
Él quiere realizar una compra de ganado y no ha completado el monto de la compra, por lo que solicita un préstamo que le permita adquirir el ganado y aumentar así el numero de animales en el corral.
Las aspiraciones de don Misael es aumentar su capacidad de negociar, mejorar la condición de vida de su esposa.
texts.en:
Don Misael, age 55, lives with his wife and sister-in-law in Usulután. He raises livestock and started this business with the help of friends who are cattle ranchers. Misael and his wife work together, but they do not have a fixed schedule by which they perform the chores related to raising cattle. They have experience in this type of business.

Misael wants to buy cattle, but he does not have enough money to complete the purchase. For this reason, he is requesting a loan that will allow him to acquire cattle and increase the number of animals in his herd. His goals include increasing his capacity to negotiate and improving the living conditions for his wife.

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Claudina Martina

texts.en:
Claudina is 36 years old. She is single and has three children. They live in the district of Las Lomas, an agricultural area situated in the province of Piura, more than four hours from Chiclayo, the capital of the region of Lambayeque. 

Claudina earns a living by operating a business selling cases of beer. She sells the drinks in two methods: retail at higher prices and wholesale at discount prices. She has five years of experience in this activity. She also sells beauty and health products, which has begun to be a profitable venture. 

She has requested a loan of 500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to invest in her businesses and purchase additional cases of beer as well as beauty and health products. She hopes to increase her income so that she can continue providing for her children and offer them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Vidal

texts.es:
Don Vidal es cliente recurrente de nuestra entidad, convive con su señora esposa hace 30 años, la Sra. Francisca Maria quien es docente; él se dedica a la compra de rollos que posteriormente los vende aserrados y trabajados, también se dedica a la fabricacion de muebles, cuenta con una antigüedad de más de 30 años en el rubro, siempre se ha caracterizado por ser cliente excelente y por sobre todo muy trabajador.
El cliente desea obtener este crédito para destinarlo a la compra de materiales, materias primas para la fabricacion de más muebles, como serruchos, martillo, lija, cepillo y rollos.
Cabe mencionar que cuenta con 3 hijos que ya son profesionales en la actualidad, gracias a su arduo sacrificio, teniendo en cuenta que eso fue su anhelo: verles profesionales a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Don Vidal is a returning client of Fundación Paraguaya.  He lives with his wife of thirty years, Francisca Maria, who is a teacher.  Vidal buys rolls of timber to sell to sawmills and construction workers.  In addition, he manufactures furniture and has thirty years of experience in this trade.  Vidal has always been known as an excellent client and a hard worker most of all.  

He wants to obtain this loan so that he can buy supplies for making furniture such as saws, hammers, sandpaper, scrub brushes, and rollers.  It should be mentioned that Vidal has three children who are now professionals.  Thanks to his hard work and sacrifice he was able to see his wish fulfilled.

loans.use: To purchase saws, hammers, sandpaper, scrub brushes, and rollers.

loans.name: Lawani Latifa

texts.fr: Coiffeuse de profession, Lawani est âgée de 26ans et est mère de 02enfants. Son mari est mécanicien. Elle a ouvert son salon de coiffure depuis 2007. Elle veut satisfaire ses nombreuses clientes c’est pour  cela elle sollicite ce prêt  pour acheter  des mèches et des pommades. Elle achète au Grand marché de Lomé et revend dans son salon de coiffure sis à Novissi (un quartier pas très loin de la ville de Lomé).  Elle veut assurer un avenir radieux à ses enfants, à elle-même et participer à la charge de la famille.
texts.en: A hairstylist by profession, Lawani is 26 years old and the mother of 2 children.  Her husband is a mechanic.  She opened her hair salon in 2007.  She wants to please her numerous clients, which is why she is requesting this loan to purchase hair extensions and pomades.  She buys at the big market of Lomé and resells in her hair salon in Novissi (a neighborhood not very far from the city of Lomé).  She wants to ensure a bright future for her children and herself, as well as participate in the care of her family.

loans.use: to purchase hair extensions and pomades.

loans.name: Santa Ana Group

texts.es: La señora Mirtha , es una de las integrantes del grupo comunal Santa Ana, una alcancía formada hace ya 10 años, que tiene como integrantes personas que  luchan cada día  para  mejorar la economía en sus hogares. Una muestra de ello es la señora Mirtha de 37 años conviviente y  madre de cuatro hijos de los cuales 3 a un son menores de edad, ella se dedica diariamente a la venta de verduras en un pequeño mercado cerca a su casa, el cual le da tiempo para poder trabajar y educar a sus hijos. Ella  comenzó en este negocio a raíz que la economía en su hogar era demasiada baja y necesitaba de mayores ingresos para poder sustentar gastos como la educación de sus hijos y mejorías para su hogar, con el esfuerzo de su trabajo a podido construir su casa y darles educación a sus hijos, en el futuro le gustaría ampliar mas su puesto de venta de verduras y poder pagar  los gastos de universidad de su hijo mayor. Con el reciente préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de verduras para la venta de su negocio.
texts.en: Mirtha is a member of the communal bank named Santa Ana, a communal bank formed 10 years ago. The members are individuals who struggle every day to improve the economy of their homes. A representative is Mirtha. She is 37 years old, married common-law, and she is the mother of 4 children, 3 of whom are minors. She sells every day vegetables at a small market near her home. Her business gives her time to work and to educate her children. The root of the reason why she started her business is that the household income was too low and they needed a greater income to be able to cover expenses such as the education of the children and home improvements. With her efforts and hard work she has been able to build a house and to provide her children with an education. In the future she would like to expand her vegetables sales business to be able to pay for her eldest son's university expenses. The recent loan will be used to purchase vegetables to sell in her business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a married woman who hails from Kyenjojo district. She is a Ugandan female aged 46 years who buys and sells local brew. A mother of four children, she dreams of educating her children and setting up other income-generating activities from which she can earn an extra income. She acquired her initial capital from a sugar cane plantation. Grace wants a loan to purchase alcohol to sell.

loans.use: To purchase alcohol to sell

loans.name: Alberta

texts.es:
Alberta es una mujer emprendedora de 44 años de edad. Ella vive con su esposo y 4 hijos en el distrito de Tambogrande – Piura.

Alberta se dedica a la venta de comida y bebidas en toda la avenida principal del mercado central de la localidad de Tambogrande. Posee un buen número de clientes y cuenta con buenas referencias personales.

Alberta solicita un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para comprar ingredientes para la preparación de su comida, así como para la compra de mercadería que ayude a mejorar el desarrollo de su negocio. Además, ella desea realizar mejoras en el local para poder ofrecer un mejor servicio y obtener mayores ganancias.

Alberta tiene su puesto en el mercado desde hace más de 20 años, ella desea mejorar la atención a sus clientes y ofrecerles mayor variedad de opciones.
texts.en:
Alberta is an enterprising woman who is 44 years old. She lives with her husband and 4 children in the district of Tambogrande - Piura.

Alberta sells food and drinks in the town of Tambogrande along the main avenue of the central market. She has a good number of customers and has good personal references.

Alberta is asking for a loan of 500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy ingredients to prepare her food and also to buy merchandise that will help to improve the development of her business. Besides, she wants to make improvements to her location to be able to offer a better service and to earn M. money.

Alberta has had her place in the market for M. than 20 years. She wants to improve the attention she gives to her customers and offer them a better variety of options.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and merchandise.

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora is 57 years old and lives in Dansalan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married and has 12 children. 

To earn a living, Dioscora has a business selling snacks. She earns about PHP 6000 each month doing this type of work. Dioscora has requested a loan to purchased raw ingredients for her snack vending. Dioscora has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Kotognontala  Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe KOTOGNOGONTALA IV sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  OUELENI FIEBALA, un des villages de la commune de KAI dans la sous préfecture  de LOULOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution et tous les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide  avec NAMINATA au milieu position debout.
Avec son prêt, elle compte payer les frais de labour, acheter des intrants et de la semence pour entretenir : 1hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de LOULOUNI et au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 145.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice la permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
Elle souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’ exploiter un espace cultural encore plus grand pour mieux en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
The ten members of the KOTOGNOGONTALA IV group are married women with an average age of 34 and an average of three children, living in polygamous families in living in polygamous families in Ouéléni Fièbala, a village in the commune of Kaï in the sub-prefecture of Loulouni, in the 3rd administrative region of Mali.  They work with the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season.  They are on their fourth loan with the organization, their former loans having been paid back.  

Naminata, standing at center in the photo, cultivates peanuts.  With her loan she plans to pay labor costs and buy fertilizer and seeds to maintain one hectare.  The crop is sold in the village, at the Loulouni market and in the Sikasso market after harvest to a customer base of both men and women.  She expects to make an average profit of 145,500 FCFA per growing season.  This profit will allow her to pay her loan and also to help her husband with daily expenses.  She wishes to maintain this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso in order to cultivate a larger area and make a bigger profit.

loans.use: to pay agricultural labor costs and buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is a 32-year-old woman from Israel's Negev region. She is the mother of 6 children and is divorced from their father but works to ensure they have a strong future. Fatma has a tent for entertaining that is used as an event venue throughout the region, for both Bedouin and Jewish holidays and special events. Over the last year she hosted bachelor and bachelorette parties, Passover celebrations, Muslim holiday parties, birthday celebrations and family gatherings.

Fatma needed this loan to redo the floor, put down concrete and to update the tent arrangements. She put in an equal amount of her own money to match the loan.

Fatma wants to create a better future for her children and ensure they receive an education. For her business she wants to continue and raise the professionalism and quality of the business for years to come.

loans.use: to renovate an entertainment tent, put down concrete and redo the floor.

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana is married and has a three-year-old son who is not of school-going age yet. Her husband runs a small Punjabi food restaurant and offers different qualities of food to his customers at cheap prices. He is very good in his customer dealings and has a good number of clients who regularly come to his restaurant and eat. 

Rukhsana supports him by sewing clothes. She is an expert in her work and receives regular orders every month. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to buy a new sewing machine for her business. This will allow her to complete her work in a shorter period of time and increase her profit. 

She has been operating her business for the past five years and is very confident that her business will improve further with the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Frankline

texts.en:
Frankline is a widower with two boys who are attending school. He lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees and clothing.

For the past ten years, Frankline has operated a carpentry business, selling in a shop to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge in competition from other carpentry operators in the area. He dreams of establishing another business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000, Frankline wants to expand his workshop and purchase more timber. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: expand his workshop and purchase more timber

loans.name: Percy

texts.en:
Percy is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Percy has a shop that sells snacks, detergents & beverages. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Percy has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Percy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Bienvenida

texts.en:
Bienvenida is 51 years old and married with four children. Two of her children are married and two are in college. She is engaged in a hog-raising business while her husband is a farmer. 

Her family is peacefully living in the village of San Pedro Maddela. According to her, she is spending her profit for her two college students, especially for their tuition fees and daily allowances. Bienvenida has had her hog-raising business for almost 31 years. She has also been a banana canvasser for 10 years. She enjoys the businesses she manages, because it is their main source of income. She would like to buy feed because the fare is expensive and their market is far away. For this reason, she requested a loan of PHP 25,000. This would really help her to maintain the businesses she has. She is hoping that she can send her children to a higher level of education.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pigs

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
La señora Luz Maria y su esposo el señor Pascual son padres de familia y tiene tres hijos que están estudiando. 
Solicitan un préstamo para comprar los útiles escolares (libros, cuadernos, plumas, lápices y carpetas) ya que les solicitan este material para poder trabajar en la escuela y que puedan terminar este siclo escolar sin ningún problema.
Espera contar con su cooperación ya que es muy importante para ellos que sus hijos tengan el estudio necesario para su futuro. 
Planean pagar el crédito con una parte del sueldo que recibe Don Pascual de su trabajo en una fábrica en el aria de producción ya que Doña Luz Maria se dedica al cuidado y tensión de la familia.
texts.en:
Señora Luz Maria and her husband, Señor Pascual, are parents of three children who attend school.

They are requesting a loan to buy school supplies (books, notebooks, pens, pencils and folders), as they need these supplies for their children to be able to do their schoolwork and to be able to finish the academic year without any problems.

She hopes to be able to count on your cooperation, as it is very important for them that their children receive the education necessary for their future.

They are planning on paying back the loan with part of the salary that Don Pascual earns from his work in production in a factory, as Doña Luz Maria focuses on taking care of and tending to the family.

loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Nancy Yaneth

texts.es: Nancy Yaneth D. cuarenta años D. edad vive con sus hijos  en un lugar muy concurrido D. personas. Ella posee una tortillería y pupuseria con la que sostiene su hogar, se ha hecho D. mucha clientela últimamente, pues Nancy prepara las mejores tortillas y pupusas al gusto del cliente D. frijol con queso, revueltas, D. queso etc. Todo con material D. excelente calidad y a precios realmente accesibles, el servicio es excelente Nancy siempre trata a sus clientes con gran amabilidad, es una mujer con grandes metas en la vida,  trabaja muy duro todos los días para alcanzarlas, su más granD. secreto es la constancia y la dedicación, quiere ver crecer el negocio es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz, queso, chicharrón, frijol entre otros. Nancy Yaneth tiene la confianza que con su arduo trabajo tendrá la oportunidad D. darle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en: Nancy Yaneth is 40 years old and lives with her children in a very busy location.  She has a tortillería and pupuseria which supports her household.   She has had a lot of customers lately, as Nancy prepares the best tortillas and pupusas.  She makes them to suit her customer's tastes such as beans and cheese, revueltas [cheese, beans, pork], just cheese, etc.  She uses excellent quality ingredients and sells them at an affordable price.  Nancy's service is excellent as she always tries to give her customers friendly service.  She is a woman with big life goals and she works very hard every day to achieve them.  Her biggest key is perseverance and dedication.  She wants to see her business grow, so for this reason she is requesting a loan through INTEGRAL that will allow her to buy corn, cheese, pork, beans, and other products.  Nancy Yaneth has confidence that with hard work she will be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy corn, cheese, pork, beans, and other products.

loans.name: Justo Lorica Group

texts.en:
Justo is married and has three children. Justo is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Justo is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. He has been doing this for two years. He has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase 10 sacks of feed for his hogs. 

Justo has been a member of PMPC for three months.

Justo is the leader of a two-person group. Although they borrow as a group, both members of the group have their own businesses.

loans.use: To purchase feed for his pigs.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 61 years old and is married with eight children. She lives in the Philippines. For the past 25 years, she has run a food shop or canteen where she sells snacks such as rice and pan cakes. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.

Margarita is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to buy raw ingredients for making snacks. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es:
Pedro vive con su esposa, aún no tiene hijos, el trabaja vendiendo artesanías, trabaja en feria fuera de los centros escolares, todos los días de la semana. 
El está solicitando renta para la compra de mercaderías como postres, juguete, calcomanías, collares, pulseras, para ofrecer a los clientes mejorando así la atención y el servicio para generar mayores ventas.
Pedro quiere mejorar el negocio, comprar su propio vehículo para trasladar la mercadería.
texts.en: Pedro lives with his wife; they don’t have children yet.  He works as a street vendor selling crafts outside schools every day of the week. He’s asking for the loan to buy merchandise like stud earrings, toys, decals, necklaces and bracelets to offer his customers thus improving service to generate more sales.  Pedro wants to improve the business and to buy his own vehicle to transport the merchandise.

loans.use: to buy stud earrings, toys, decals, necklaces and bracelets.

loans.name: Maria Nidia

texts.es:
La señora Nidia a sus 43 años de edad,  inicia desde hace dos años su pequeño negocio de cría de cerdos y engorde de pollos en una vereda del municipio de Sopetran ubicado al occidente de Antioquia,  luego de tener la necesidad de generar sus propios ingresos puesto que el padre de sus dos hijos la abandonó, quedando ella sola con la responsabilidad del hogar.  La señora Nidia decide emprender en su propia casa este negocio con el fin de estar al cuidado de sus hijos. Todo lo aplicado en su negocio es gracias a su madre quien toda su vida se ha dedicado a esta labor y le enseño todo lo relacionado a este trabajo a su hija.
En el negocio le colaboran sus dos hijos en los tiempos libres, quienes se encuentran estudiando gracias al trabajo de su madre. La hija mayor de Nidia de 20 años de edad ingresará a la Universidad y el hijo menor de 17 años de edad está terminando el bachillerato, por estos motivos la señora Nidia desea comprar 50 pollos, 3 cerdos, cuido para la alimentación de los animales y adecuaciones locativas en el arreglo del piso de su negocio para tener mayores ventas, incrementar sus ingresos  y de esta manera seguir cumpliendo todas las responsabilidades en su hogar y de su familia que están a cargo de ella.
texts.en:
Nidia is 43 years old.  Two years ago she started her own small business raising pigs and fattening chickens in Sopetran which is located to the west of Antioquia.  She needed to make her own income as the father of her two children abandoned her, leaving her alone with responsibility for her household.  Nidia decided to start this business in her own home so that she could care for her children.  All the knowledge she applies to her business is thanks to her mother who also carried out this type of work and taught her daughter everything about the business.

Nidia's two children help her with her business in their free time.  They are both studying thanks to their mother's work.  Nidia's eldest [daughter] is 20 years old and will enter university.  Her youngest [son] is 17 years old and is finishing high school.  For this reason, Nidia would like to buy 50 chickens, 3 pigs and feed for her animals.  She will also make some structural improvements by fixing the floor of her business so that she can make more sales, increase her income and, in this way, continue fulfilling her household responsibilities and taking care of her family who are dependent on her.

loans.use: to buy pigs and chickens and to make some structural improvements to the floor of her business

loans.name: Pierrette Akouavi

texts.fr: Pierrette Akouavi est âgée de 52 ans et vit au Bénin. Pierrette Akouavi est mariée à un enseignant du nom de François. Pierrette Akouavi a arrêté l'école au niveau secondaire. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a trois autres enfants en charge. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Pierrette Akouavi vend depuis vingt ans de divers articles et des céréales (maïs, riz, haricot et farine de manioc). Grâce au revenu que lui génère cette activité, Pierrette Akouavi contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Pierrette Akouavi sollicite pour une quatrième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement par Pierrette Akouavi ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Pierrette Akouavi is 52 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a teacher named François. She dropped out of middle school. The couple has three children in school to support. In addition to their children, they have three other children to support. The children live together with their parents. The couple jointly ensures that the diverse household expenses are covered. 

To support herself and her children, Pierrette Akouavi has been selling a variety of goods and grains (corn, rice, beans, and cassava flour) for twenty years. Thanks to the income this business generates for her, she is helping with the family expenses. 

To satisfy the needs of her burgeoning customer base, Pierrette Akouavi is requesting a loan from ALIDé for a fourth time. The loans she previously received have indeed been repaid.

loans.use: to buy sacks of corn, rice, beans and cassava flour

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: Rosa is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with 6 children. Rosa has operated a food shop for 10 years, selling snacks such as rice cakes or suman, banana rolls and boiled eggs. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks. Rosa is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.es: La señora María vive en la zona de Villa armonía, es viuda y tiene un hijo con el que vive en la casa de los padres de ella. María se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y productos de belleza los cuales reparte a crédito a varios clientes de la zona y otros lugares de la zona central. Su hijo tiene un equipo de amplificación que alquila para todo tipo de acontecimientos sociales. Es la primera vez que María trabaja con préstamos de emprender y espera utilizar el dinero para la compra de más productos de belleza y así incrementar su capital y sus ingresos. De manera paralela a la venta de los productos de belleza, María también se dedica a la costura junto a su hermana pero esta actividad solo es por temporada. Ella anhela poder algún día comprar una casita e incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Sra. María lives in the District of Villa Armonía. She is a widow and lives with her son at her parents’ house. María sells cosmetics and beauty products on credit to her various customers in the area and in other places within the central district. Her son owns sound equipment that he rents out for all types of social events.

This is the first time that María has worked with loans from Emprender and she hopes to utilize the money by purchasing more beauty products so that she can increase her capital and her income. In addition to selling beauty products, María works as a seamstress alongside her sister. However, she engages in this work only a seasonal basis. Her wish someday is to buy a small house and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is 21 years old and single. He sells health products such as medicine, soap and food supplements to earn a living and has been in the business for one year. Besides that, he owns a mobile phone accessories shop where he also does mobile phone repairs.  

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has become a business-minded person through the trainings he gets from Faulu Kenya on business management. He hopes to expand his business and become financially stable in the future.  He has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy medicine.

loans.use: To buy medicine.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 31 years old, married and has three children.  He makes and sells drums and traditional guitars to earn a living.  He has been in the business for 11 years and has employed four people.  He also sells charcoal for extra income generation. 
 
Through Faulu Kenya, he has learnt how to save his money.  He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy raw materials for making drums such as wood and skins.

loans.use: To buy raw materials such as wood and skins.

loans.name: Duo Guadalupe Group

texts.es:
DUO GUADALUPE
Tiburcia    de 49 años  que se dedica a la venta de frutas  y helados  donde ella vive  desde hace 17 años  ella necesita otro crédito para invertir para este tiempo de Semana Santa  es donde aprovecha a generar más ingresos y poder salir a vender helados  en la aldea con la ayuda de su esposo, su deseo es poder agrandar su negocio y tener variedad de frutas  para que su clientela no suba al pueblo a comprar  y así  mismo poder ser un apoyo económico en su hogar y sacar adelante a su familia, solicitan este credito para la compra de frutas y productos para elavorar elados para la venta.

loans.use: Compra de frutas y productos para elavorar elados para la venta.

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Madina

texts.en: Madina lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are going to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She has been in this business for 15 years. She has operated a retail shop in a rented shop from home. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 2,400,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy sugar, rice, soap, cooking oil, flour and beans. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation . She would like to build more houses. She lives in her own house with access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include food, and school fees.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, soap, cooking oil, flour and beans.

loans.name: Asana

texts.en: Asana has been in this business for about 8 years now, she cooks food and sell to school children in 4 schools located within the community. Currently she cooks about 2 maxi bags of rice weekly. However due to the ever increasing demand for her appetizing and delicious meals from the school children and the community at large, she would like to increase the weekly sales from 2 bags to 6 bags of rice. She intends employing 2 additional staffs to assist her. she has requested a KIVA loan amount of $650 and hopes to use it judiciously in order to plough back profits. she has also participated in the TEACH lending of Kraban Support Foundation.

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia lives in Nkurankan in the Eastern Region of Ghana in a farming community. She buys corn direct from the farmers and sells to retailers in the big towns and cities. She has a problem transporting the produce to her customers. She needs a Kiva loan of $900.00 to help her solve this problem.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She will invest the loan in the purchase of materials and products to stock her business

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria C. A., 40, makes tablecloths, bedspreads, and other large woven items from her home. Three other women also weave with her. She's a member of the group of women "Caseria Cooperativa".

A typical piece that she makes costs about Q100, or US$13, and will fetch Q150, or US$20 on the market; it takes one week's labor to make. Maria makes the trip to another city every weekend to sell the items they produce at two stalls in the town.

Without the loans she would not be able to do business. It's important to be able to buy the raw materials in order to have adequate inventory. Maria has her own house, but has no land of her own. She has five children and is married to husband Juan, who has had lung problems for the last ten years and has been unable to work.

loans.use: to buy the raw materials in order to have adequate inventory for weaving

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan is 40 years old and lives with his Brazilian wife and their 3 children who are 15 years, 13 years, and 11 months old. The two eldest children attend high school.

Juan started working as a tailor approximately 16 years ago when he was invited by two of his brothers to travel to the neighboring country of Brazil to work. He learned everything that he knows working there for a dressmaking company and later managed to start working independently as soon as he was able to buy his own sewing machine. Three years later he decided to return to Paraguay and start his own dressmaking shop out of his home where he employed three people to help him with his business.

Currently he makes clothing for a well-known athletic clothing company. His dream is to one day be able to buy a good vehicle to use in the transport of his merchandise. At the moment he is in need of a loan to buy more material to fulfill his many orders.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric

loans.name: Habiba

texts.ru:
Habiba is 56. She is a single mother of five children. The elder children already have families of their own. The eldest daughter is married and has a business of her own. Habiba has provided her daughter with valuable advice that allowed her to start her own business. Habiba's youngest son is currently helping her with the business. Habiba was one of the first clients of MicroInvest in the city of Spitamen. Over the time that she has been a client of MicroInvest, she was able to significantly increase turnover. She is planing to continue being a MicroInvest client.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Хабибе 56 лет. У нее нет мужа и она самостоятельно воспитывает 5 детей. Старшие дети уже имеют свои семьи. Старшая дочь вышла замуж и имеет свой собственный бизнес. В этом есть заслуга и Хабибы, которая во многом помогла ей своими советами. Сейчас Хабибе помогает ее младший сын. Хабиба одна из первых клиенток Микроинвест в Спитамене. За то время, которое она сотрудничает с Микроинвест, ее товарооборот возрос намного. Хабиба и дальше собирается сотрудничать с Микроинвест.

loans.use: To increase turnover

loans.name: Zaida

texts.es:
Mrs Zaida is 51 years old, has 3 children and has a business selling spare parts (for bikes, cars and three wheeler vans).

Her husband, Fernando, is a car mechanic and helps her out because the most important thing for both of them is to give their children enough opportunities so that later on they can become good professionals.

Zaida has always been very active and enterprising, therefore she does not count the hours she works and her business is open 24 hours.

In order to fulfill all the requests from her clients, she needs to improve the facilities of her business. Let’s try to make her request possible so she can materialize all her plans.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Zaida de 51 años de edad, tiene tres hijos y se dedica a la venta de repuestos, su esposo, Fernando, la apoya ejerciendo su función de mecánico; debido a que para ambos lo más importante es brindarles bienestar a sus tres queridos hijos esperando más adelante sean buenos profesionales. Para Zaida no existen prioridades, ya que ella siempre ha sido muy activa y sobre todo emprendedora, por esta razón no cuenta con un horario de trabajo ya que atiende las 24 horas del día. Y para cumplir con cada una de las peticiones de sus clientes necesita implementar su negocio y acrecentar sus instalaciones, por que cuenta con una clientela muy activa. Posibilitemos su petición para que pronto concrete cada uno de sus planes.

loans.use: To improve the facilities of her shop and buy more spare part products

loans.name: Alveena's Group

texts.en:
I am Alveena Y. M.. I have lived all my life in Kot Radha Kishan, a small town in Pakistan. I am married and a mother of four: two sons and two daughters. We live in a three-room brick house. My husband drives a small two-wheeled cart pulled by a horse known as a tanga, and he transports goods on order. All of my kids attend school except one, who dropped out of school due to lack of interest in studies, and another one is not of school going age yet.

We now require a loan to replace our cart as the older one is in very bad condition. I plan to repair my house when our profits increase.

I have several women in my group and all of us need loans: Azra B. wants a loan to expand their lumberyard. Parveen B. will invest this credit in their salon. Barkat B. needs to buy sheep for their livestock trading. Rukhsana B. plans to buy a cow. Noreen B. needs a loan to buy bricks for their business.

loans.use: Buy a new cart

loans.name: Mey

texts.en:
Mrs. Mey S., 38, works with her husband on their farm growing rice and raising horses, making about $3 each day in income. This couple has seven children. One of their children works making incense; another one is a garment worker; one is enrolled in school and the rest are married and live separately.

Mrs. Mey S. is humbly requesting a loan to expand her livestock by adding another healthy horse to breed so as to generate more profit.

loans.use: To purchase another horse to breed

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi H., 55 years old, is a third year member of TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam).  Her five children are all grown up.  She now lives with her husband and their youngest child.  For more than 10 years, heir family main income has come from pigs breeding.  After deducting the cost of piglets and food for them, each year she earns some hundreds USD in profit.  This money is rather enough for her to pay for the living expenses.  One of the advantages she has is that her children all have their own jobs, and they sometimes help her with the weekly repayment.  This year, thinking that she is getting old, Mrs. H. intends to buy a cow, raise and later sell it.  This job is easier than breeding pigs.  She ask for a loan of 400USD.

 Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer. 

Chị Nguyễn Thị H., 55 tuổi, là thành viên năm thứ 3 của Quỹ Tình thương. 5 người con lớn trưởng thành, chị sống cùng chồng và người con út. Nguồn thu nhập chủ yếu của gia đình hơn mười năm nay từ nguồn chăn nuôi lợn. Trừ chi phí mua lợn con và thức ăn gia súc mỗi năm chị H. cũng thu lãi vài trăm USD. Số tiền này cũng tương đối đủ cho các khoản chi tiêu hàng ngày. Một thuận lợi với chị H. là các con đều có công việc và hỗ trợ chị trong việc trả tiền tuần. Năm nay, thấy cũng đã có tuổi, chị định mua 1 con bò về chăn và bán khi được giá. Công việc này nhẹ nhàng hơn so với chăn nuôi lợn. Mức vốn đề nghị của chị H. là 400USD.

loans.use: Buy beeves

loans.name: "kullaquitas" Group

texts.es:
In the city of El Alto, in the Rio Seco zone is found the Pro-Mujer "pan-american" center. Inside this center we find the "kullakitas" association, comprised of 15 associates that form an united, organized and happy group.

Almost all of them are married with an average of 4 children each, generally young. The majority of their children are under the age of 15. They tell us that it is difficult for them to support their large families with the current situation in the country, since basic supplies have risen in price substantially and the few resources that they can obtain do not give them enough to live on.

Most of them are dedicated chiefly to crafts, being carpenters. They produce furniture with old designs in carved wood. Also they weave sweaters with Alpaca wool and aguayos (blanket woven with native designs), products that they offer to tourist stores in the city of La Paz. The "Kullaquitas" association needs to increase its capital for the purchase of materials. In this way they hope to increase their production and acquire their own stores to sell their products directly. In this way their profits will also increase with the sole objective of giving their small children a tranquil and stable life.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

En la ciudad de El Alto, en la zona de rio seco se encuentra en centro focal “Panamericana” de Pro-Mujer, dentro este centro encontramos a la asociación “kullakitas”, integradas por 15 socias que forman un grupo unido, organizado y alegre.

Casi todas estan casadas con un promedio de 4 hijos, por lo general pequeños la mayoria menores a los 15 años, ellas nos cuentan que les resulta dificil mantener estas numerosas familias por la actual situacion del pais ya que los productos de primera necesidad subieron de precio cuantiosamente y los pocos recursos que ellas consiguen no les abastece para subsistir.

La mayor parte de ellas se dedica principalmente a la artesania, siendo asi el oficio de la carpinteria, donde producen muebles con diseños antiguos en madera tallada, tambien realizan el tejido de chompas en lana de Alpaca, y tejido de aguayos ( manta tejida con diseños autoctonos), productos que los ofrecen a tiendas turisticas de la ciudad de La Paz. La asociacion "Kullaquitas" necesita incrementar su capital para la compra de materia prima, de esta forma incrementara su produccion y alquilarian tiendas propias para vender sus productos de manera directa, de esta forma sus ganancias tambien aumentarian con el unico objetivo de brindar a sus pequeños hijos una vida estable y tranquila.

loans.use: To purchase materials (wood and wool) and to acquire their own stores to sell their crafts.

loans.name: Aziza's Udugu Group

texts.en:
Aziza is 42 years old and is a married woman with 5 children, ages 30, 27, 25, 22, 19 and 16 years old. Aziza owns a small grocery store and sells fish. She opened her store 16 years ago in 1991. Every day, she works from 8am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food and fish for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Hery, who also sells food.

loans.use: To buy mre food items and fish for her business.

loans.name: Alvaro Alfredo

texts.en:
Alvaro is 54 years old and originally from Alto Molocue, a district in the Zambezia Province. Alvaro is married and has seven people under his responsibility.

Alvaro was raised by his parents until he was 14 years old, when he moved to Maputo to continue his studies at the Seminario Sagrado Coracao de Jesus. Since 1975 Alvaro has been working at the Maritime Administration of Maputo, hence all his experience is in the fishing business.

Alvaro decided to start his fishing business in 2000 after the severe flood that happened in Mozambique and destroyed many businesses. He is currently working at the Macaneta region in the Catembe district, a village 10 minutes' ferry boat ride away from the capital city of Maputo. Alvaro has one employee who coordinates all the work with other temporary workers and fishermen.

With his first Kiva loan of MTn 25,000 Alvaro intends to buy fishing nets, water wings and weights to improve his business, allowing him to diversify his fishing operations.

In the future Alvaro would like to buy another boat to use for tourism, as he considers the market very attractive.

loans.use: To buy materials to improve his fishing business.

loans.name: Yim

texts.en:
Yim H., 41, lives in the Kampong Cham province with her husband, Bes Nov, and their five children. She works in her field as a farmer making US$ 1 each day, while her husband collects palm juice, making US$ 5 each day. He is then able to take the palm juice and refine it into palm sugar. The family is also supported through the employment of one of their daughters who works in a local garment factory, but the other children are students.

Yim H. has asked for a loan of US$ 300 to purchase another plot of farmland to expand her current rice crops. She believes that this expanded property will yield a profitable harvest for her and she will be able to increase her income and improve her standard of living. She sees this also as a long-term investment opportunity, because the price of land in Cambodia has been rising rapidly, especially out in the rural areas.

loans.use: Purchase farmland

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en: Zuhura D., a married Tanzanian woman with four children, is a food vendor in Makangarawe in Temeke District. Her current customers are from nearby retail shops and a small market; her business dream is to have a café with an hygienic cooking environment and a stable clientèle. Zahura is requesting a loan of $550 to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: La

texts.en: Mrs. La I., who is 59 years old, is a farmer growing rice. Additionally, she makes and sells mats from her home, earning around US $2 per day. Her husband, Mr. Cheap Choeurn, who is 58 years old, is a construction worker and earns typically US $2 per day. La has three children, two of whom are married and another of whom is studying and stays home. To increase her rice yield, La would like to request a loan of US $100 to purchase fertilizer.

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizer

loans.name: Debora

texts.en: Debora D. lives in Llogbo, Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells frozen food and she also grinds pepper, tomatoes and beans. She sells frozen foods like fish, beef, chicken and turkey. The demand for her frozen foods is high and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. Debora has been in this business for the past 4 years. She is a LAPO client. Debora is 34 years old and married with 4 children. She needs a loan of $425 to enable her buy more frozen food to sell. She says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more frozen foods to sale

loans.name: Fatma's Group

texts.en:
Fatma owns a small shop in Zanzibar where she works for 18 hours every day and earns a monthly profit of approximately $115. Having repaid her first loan from BRAC Tanzania on time, she is requesting a second one in order to increase her inventory and expand her business.

Fatma is 29 years old, married and has a one-year-old child. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Mkongwe.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her shop.

loans.name: Nkechi

texts.en: Nkechi is 30 years old and married with a child. She sells bags of rice and beans wholesale and retail. She started this business in 2004. Nkechi is a LAPO client. She hopes for the loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more bags of rice and beans to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase bags of rice and beans to sell

loans.name: Ambaroy

texts.en:
Ambaroy B. lives in Khujand. She is the mother of 12 children. She works in the bazaar, selling warm women's wear. She works in her business with her children. They bring the parcels from China and Uzbekistan, and she also goes to Istaravshan to buy merchandise. She has been in business for 15 years.

Mrs. Ambaroy B. is asking KIVA for financial support for her existing business in the form of a business support loan of 2300 TJS for 6 months to import in quantity as it is the season for warm women's jackets.

loans.use: to expand her inventory of warm jackets for women

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mrs. Heng S., 59, has five children: three sons and two daughters. Three of her children are married and live outside the family home; one daughter is a silk weaver. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Heng has been a textile designer for twenty-four years, a skill she learned from a relative. She designs patterns for silk fabric. Heng is requesting a loan of US$ 300 to build a toilet for the family to use.

loans.use: To build a toilet for the family to use

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan Andiiria is currently in the business of brewing local alcohol. Susan is 38 years old and married. Her husband is a businessman. She has four children who all go to school. She is requesting a loan to expand the business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business brewing local alcohol.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose T. is 48 years old. She is a married woman with three children. Two have completed the junior high school and the last born is in primary school. She lives with her family at Wasa Simpa in the western region of Ghana. 

For the past three years, Rose has been baking bread and supplying it to the villages around. She also sells some to individuals. Demand for the bread has increased as a result of constant supply and just-in-time delivery. Her customers book their order in advance and it is ready before they come. She says that the price of commodities is rising, which is making it difficult to buy more raw materials from the market and the daily demand for bread is high. She says she bakes almost 700 loaves of bread in a day. 

Rose needs a loan to buy more flour, sugar, margarine, milk and firewood to restock her inventory. Rose belongs to a village bank called ‘St Martin’s’. She also hope to receive GH¢700 to improve her business by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy baking materials

loans.name: Honoré

texts.fr:
H. Honoré est né vers 1966 à Ganvié. Initié à la pêche dès son enfance,la pêche constitue encore aujourd'hui la seule et unique activité de H. Honoré. H. Honoré mène sa pêche depuis dix ans dans les eaux de la lagune de Cotonou, Capitale économique du Bénin. H. Honoré est marié et père de 5 enfants dont deux  sont scolarisés. Les trois autres enfants de H. Honoré l'aident pour la pêche. H. Honoré a déjà deux crédits avec ALIDé. Avec ces deux prêts, H. Honoré a vu son niveau de vie s'amélioré. C'est pour acquérir de nouveaux filets de plus grande résistance que H. Honoré sollicite un troisième prêt. Dans l'avenir H. Honoré souhaite acquérir une seconde  barque motorisée. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Honoré H. was born circa 1966 in Ganvié. Introduced to fishing during his childhood, this still constitutes his only business. He's been fishing for ten years in the Cotonou lagoon. Cotonou is the economic capital of Benin. He's married and the father of 5 children, out of which two attend school. The other three help him fish. Honoré H. already benefited from two loans from Kiva's partner Alidé. With these loans, he managed to improve his standard of living. He's seeking a third loan to purchase new, stronger fishnets. In the future, he wishes to buy a second motorized small boat.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 3 rolls of fishnet with all fishing accessories

loans.name: Itaf
