texts.en: Itaf T. is 50 years old, married with 5 children, grown and living independently. Her money-earning activity is selling sewing notions; she is asking Ryada for a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase more buttons, poplin, and fasteners. Itaf says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: purchase more buttons, poplin, and fasteners for re-sale

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
La Señora Veronica es socia del Banco Comunal Manuela Ramos, en el Distrito de Mazo-Cruz, Provincia del Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 30 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y tiene 3 hijos.  Tiene estudios secundarios solo hasta cuarto año.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 4 años, su primer crédito fue de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitio aumentar su capital para mejorar su negocio de compra y venta de ganado menor (ovejas).
Con este préstamo de S/ 2,500.00 Nuevos Soles, podrá comprar ovejas para su comercializaciòn.

Su mayor deseo es comprar una casa y un carro para transportar su mercaderia.

Manifiesta que le agrada el tipo de trabajo que desarrolla Manuela Ramos y sobre todo está contenta con la metodología de ahorros.
texts.en:
Mrs. Veronica is a member of the Manuela Ramos Community Bank, in the district of Mazo-Cruz, in the province of Collao, in the department of Puno. She is 30 years old, lives with her partner, and has 3 children. She has finished her fourth year of secondary school. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 4 years. Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles, which allowed her to increase her capital so that she could improve her business of buying and selling young livestock (sheep). With this loan of 2500 nuevos soles, she will be able to buy sheep to sell them. Her biggest dream is to buy a house and a car so that she can transport her merchandise. She shows that she is thankful for the work that Manuela Ramos does and, above all, she is happy with the method of savings.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy young livestock (sheeo)

loans.name: Femmes Commercantes 6 Group

texts.fr: Les 5 femmes membres du groupe sont unies par le bon voisinage depuis longtemps. Elles sont dans un groupe fédéral de toutes les femmes de la commune de Thiès. C'est le groupement qui a été subdivisé en groupe de 5 pour faciliter la gestion. Les groupes sont créés par affinité par les femmes elles-mêmes. Elles mènent diverses activités génératrices de revenus et soutiennent leurs maris dans la prise en charges de leur famille respective. Le groupe s'autofinançait par une tontine interne mais avec le crédit de l'IMCEC il trouve des moyens plus importants et un délai court pour le financement de leurs activités. La plupart d’entre elles ont des étalages au marché central de Thiès commune ou elles vendent légumes, poisson, bijoux, tissus, etc.
texts.en:
The five women members of the group have been united by neighborly ties for a long time. They are in a federal group of all the women of the community of Thiès. This association is subdivided into groups of five to facilitate the managing of it. The groups are created by affinity among the women themselves. The group members do a diversity of income-generating work and support their husbands in providing for their respective families. The group used to finance itself through an internal tontine, but with IMCEC credit, greater financing in a short time can be gotten for businesses. Most of the women have displays of goods at the central market of Thiès, where they sell vegetables, fish, jewelry, cloth, etc.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy local products in weekly rural marketplaces and fishing areas for resale in town

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith T. is from the village of Yahong,Tudela,Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old. Judith is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Judith owns & operates a general store. She sells a variety of different products in the local community. Judith has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In May 2009, Judith joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Judith is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Judith from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products for her store.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 54 years old. She is married and the mother of four children. Currently all the kids are in school. She loves selling goods, the business through which she obtains her livelihood.  She has been selling onions for a year now to support her family. Her husband is a farmer in the community.
She buys the onions from the Koforidua market and sells them through hawking in Suhum community. For lack of funds, she buys her onions at retail price making it difficult to make a profit. She requests a loan to travel to the northern region of Ghana so that she can buy onions in bags. This saves her from middlemen who buy from the farmers and resell to her at higher prices. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her kids in school. Margaret belongs to a village bank called ‘Nyame Adom’ which literary means God’s Grace. This, she believes, will enable her to save more to support her husband in taking care of their home.

loans.use: To buy large quantities of onions.

loans.name: Elegbede

texts.en: C. sells foodstuffs and frozen food. She has been in this business for the past 15 years. C. lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 47 and is married with 4 children. She requests a loan of N80, 000 to purchase more foodstuffs and frozen foods, like chicken and turkey.  She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and frozen food to sell

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is married and has a son. She lives and works in Zaporozhye. Marina owns a small footwear sales enterprise at one of the biggest markets in her home town. She has a loyal clientele and offers a flexible pricing policy that attracts many customers. Marina has been in business for 15 years. Presently, she has about 50,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her monthly net profit is about 3,000 Grivnyas.

Marina is seeking a loan of 12,100 Grivnyas to restock her merchandise for the coming fall season. Summer is always a slow season for small market vendors in Ukraine, so Marina is hoping to catch up on her sales in fall when customer demand usually goes up.

loans.use: To purchase more seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy containers for milk and chemical medicine

loans.name: Keji

texts.en: Keji M. is currently in the business of selling green vegetables at the market and is requesting a loan to purchase cooking oil to sell.  M. is 25 years old and is Married with a husband that is a peasant . She has 1 child and her child does not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rental purpose BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Alodokpo Elise

texts.fr: M. Alodokpo Elise est née en 1971 dans la commune d’Avrankou. Elise est mariée et est mère de trois (3) enfants. Elise est coiffeuse de profession. Pour une meilleure prestation de son service, Elise a besoin de séchoir, un outil de travail très important pour la coiffure. Mais, Elise ne dispose pas d’assez de moyens financiers pour acquérir son appareil. C’est la raison pour laquelle Elise sollicite l’appui financier d’ALIDé pour y arriver.
texts.en:
Alodokpo Elise M. was born in 1971 in the village of Avrankou. Elise is married and she is the mother of three children. Elise is a hair stylist by training. So that she might be able to provide greater quality in service, Elise needs a hair dryer, a tool very important for hair styling. But Elise does not have enough financial resources to purchase the dryer. That is the reason why Elise is requesting financial support from Alide (Kiva Field Partner.).


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a hair dryer.

loans.name: Lucia Del Carmen

texts.es: Lucia del Carmen tiene la edad de 27 años. Su actividad económica es una pulpería, hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que con todo su esfuerzo ha logrado mantenerla. Ella tiene 3 hijos a su cargo por lo que todos son menores de edad por la buena administración de Lucia ha logrado su negocio ha crecido. La ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda, en donde ofrece productos de primera necesidad como son los granos básicos ya que en su mayoría de clientes, son personas que viven por los alrededores.  Por la necesidad de cada día Lucia lucha con proporcionarles a sus hijos lo necesario es por eso que solicita este financiamiento para la inversión de su negocio. En futuro le gustaría ampliar su negocio y vender ropa.
texts.en:
Lucia del Carmen is 27 years old. Her business is a general store, which she has operated for more than 6 years. She has managed to keep it going by working as hard as she can. Lucia is also taking care of her three young children, but thanks to her good management, she has been able to expand her business. The store is located in her home, where she offers basic products such as dry grains. The majority of her customers are people who live nearby. Each day, Lucia struggles to make ends meet and to provide for her children's needs, and for this reason she is requesting this loan to invest in her business. In the future, she would like to further expand her business and sell clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital de Trabajo

loans.name: Osagie

texts.en:
Osagie is 38 years old and married with two children. He has been a farmer for the past 8 years and has been with LAPO Microfinance for over two years.

Osagie is requesting the loan of N30,000. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more seeds to plant and to cultivate his farmland

loans.name: Eliud

texts.en:
Eliud O. owns the Purple Hut salon located on a retail street in the town of Kangemi.  His clients are primarily middle-class women. He offers plaiting, haircuts and sets, manicures and pedicures. His business challenges are lack of capital and strong competition in the area. 

He is using the proceeds of 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to increase his stock of beauty products. His business goals are to have a larger salon in Kangemi and to establish some satellite branches. Eliud has a wife and a 3-year-old son. He describes himself as smart, hardworking and successful. He serves as the chairman of the Carnivore 2009 borrowing group.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad R. is 59 years old, living in the Barangay Marobbob Amulung,Cagayan. She is married to Catalino, 62 years old, a local farmer in their community. They are blessed with six grown up children. All of her children are married and live independently.
Felicidad is very proud to have responsible, hardworking children. Felicidad operates her general store in their village. She sells a variety of goods and groceries including vegetables, candies, bread, canned goods, cooking ingredients and household tools. Much of their income goes towards their daily basic needs.
Felicidad is requesting a loan from the KIVA lenders amounting to PHP 7,000 to support her general store.
Felicidad will be very grateful if the loan is granted because it will help her family and her business.

loans.use: Additional capital for her store.

loans.name: María Hilda

texts.es: María Hilda R. D. P. D. 59 años D. edad, resiD. en Ciudad Delgado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Comparte su hogar junto a su esposo, hijos y nietos. María posee una tienda y una librería en su propia casa, y es a través D. dicho negocio, la cual le ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ya que a pesar que sus hijos son mayores, deben velar por sus propias necesidades. María solícita un préstamo a través del cual ella pueda comprar productos perecederos, ya que en la actualidad cuenta con pocos productos para la tienda, así mismo desea poder surtir la librería y poder aprovechar el inicio a clases, el cual será a principios del próximo año y es por esto que María desea tener su negocio muy equipado.
texts.en:
María Hilda R. D. P., 59, lives in Delgado city in the San Salvador department. She shares her home with her husband, children, and grandchildren. María has a store and a bookstore in her own house. Through these businesses she helps her husband with the household expenses. In spite of the fact that her children are grown, they should watch out for their own needs. María is asking for a loan to be able to buy perishable products. She currently has few products in her store. She also wishes to be able to stock the bookstore and take advantage of the start up of classes. They will start at the beginning of next year, and María wants her store to be well equipped.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for her bookstore and perishable products for her store

location.town: Ciudad Delgado en el departamento de San  Salvador

loans.name: Maurice Were

texts.en: Maurice Were O. is 58 years of age, married and a father of 12 children. His main source of income to provide for his family is farming. He is a former civil servant and, after retirement, he ventured into farming as a means of self-employment. Maurice would like a loan of KES 20,000 which will be used to buy seeds and fertilizer in preparation for the oncoming rains in early 2010. Maurice is a jovial individual and his main plan and dream is to always manage to ensure food security for his family while acquiring income from farming at the local market where he sells his produce.

loans.use: buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Yem

texts.en:
Yem T., 43, and his wife have been growing morning glories to sell since 2001. He is married and lives with his five children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. He earns US $8 per day. The family is also supported by two of his children who currently work for a private company earning US $7 each per day to help cover the family's expenses. 
T. and his children try to work hard every day to secure a good standard of living for the family. They are seeking to improve their businesses. Therefore, he is requesting a loan of US $700 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. He wants to use the loan to purchase seeds to grow more morning glories for his regular customers at the market. This is his first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy morning glory seeds

loans.name: Khun

texts.en: Khun C., 54, is married and lives with his four children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. C. grows morning glories, earning an income of US $6 per day. He has been doing this business since 1993. His wife looks after the children and helps her husband grow more vegetables, earning US $6 per day. C. and his family members try to work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family. They are seeking to improve their businesses as well as to get rid of the daily necessary expenses. Therefore, C. is requesting a loan of US $1,000 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. He wants to use the loan to buy more morning glory seeds and a motorbike for the children to use to commute to school. This is his first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy seeds and a motorbike

loans.name: Zamina

texts.en: Zamina A. is 51 years old, married, and has three daughters. Zamina sells slippers and school bags in the central market of Agsu. She has seven years of experience in this field. Her business is the only  source of income for her family. She tries her best to provide her children with all the necessities of life. To increase her profit, Zamina has applied for 1600 AZ. She will use her loan to purchase more shoes and diversify the products that she sells. You can be an important part of Zamina`s business.

loans.use: To diversify and purchase more products to sell.

loans.name: Agnès

texts.fr: Née en 1955 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin, B. Agnès vit depuis 15 ans à PK11 dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji au Bénin.  Agnès est veuve et mère de six enfants, dont deux sont encore à sa charge.  Agnès vit seule avec ses enfants.  Agnès n’a fait que l’école primaire, mais tous les enfants sont scolarisés.  Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Agnès vend de la nourriture (pâte de maïs, sauce, riz, etc.).  Agnès exerce cette activité depuis 12 ans et s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin.  Agnès est une nouvelle bénéficiaire de ALIDé. Très sollicitée par ses clients, Agnès ambitionne renforcer son activité et agrandir son étalage afin de faire face à la demande sans cesse croissante. C’est la raison pour laquelle Agnès sollicite son premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1955 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin, Ms. B. Agnès has been living in PK11, in the town of Sèmè-Podji, Benin, for fifteen years. She is a widow and the mother of six children, of whom two are still in her care. She lives alone with her children. Agnès attended primary school only. To support herself, she sells food (cornmeal polenta, sauce, rice, etc.) She has been in this business for twelve years and gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She is a new beneficiary of ALIDé. In high demand by her customers, she has the ambition of bolstering her business and expanding her display of goods, so as to cope with the ever-growing demand. For these reasons, Agnès is requesting her first loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying corn, fish, and condiments

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita Q. is a 49-year-old married woman who lives in Martisan, Bacong, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by selling fish. Lolita’s husband, Zamue, sometimes helps his wife in running the business. They have four adult children who are currently employed and help support some of the needs of the family. Lolita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in March 1999 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in fish-vending. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 20,000. Lolita is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 29,500 was used to fund operations for her fish-vending business which had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing Php 29,500 for her 16th loan, which she intends to use in her fish-vending business. Lolita is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her fish-vending business

loans.name: Sam-Un

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam-un L., 52 (pictured with her husband), and her husband, Mr. Yeun Yin, 58, live in a small village across the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1979 and have ten children: eight sons and two daughters. Three of them are married and live outside the family home, one is a construction worker, three have full-time employment and the other four attend school.  

Sam-un has been farming for 30 years. Her husband is a retired policeman, who now drives a horse cart in his village. Sam-un is asking for her first loan of $300 USD to purchase a water pumping machine to spray her farm.

loans.use: To purchase a water pumping machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more slippers to sell.

loans.name: Jose Filemon

texts.es:
El Señor JOSE FILEMON M. C. Labora como Conductor en la Universidad Nacional de Ingeniería  (UNI) de Managua.
 El  tiene cuatro hijos a su cargo, y estos se  encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado siete créditos con CEPRODEL durante siete años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido siete créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: Cemento, arena, hierro  y piedra para la construcción de un cuarto para su hijo mayor.
Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
El Señor JOSE FILEMON M. C. Labora como Conductor en la Universidad Nacional de Ingeniería (UNI) de Managua. El tiene cuatro hijos a su cargo, y estos se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado siete créditos con CEPRODEL durante siete años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido siete créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL, el es un cliente excelente. El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: Cemento, arena, hierro y piedra para la construcción de un cuarto para su hijo mayor. Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: MEJORAS DE VIVIENDA Y AMPLIACION

loans.name: Gusnara

texts.es:
Gusnara es una madre de familia de 55 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el caserío Hualtacal del distrito de Olmos, una zonca conocida a nivel regional por tener a la mayoría de su población concentrada de áreas rurales que distan mucho una de la otra, sus actividades productivas son la agricultura y la crianza y venta de animales, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a mas de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace tres años a criar animales menores como ovejas y cerdos, en la zona es usual que los pobladores durante el dia críen a sus animales libres por las campiñas que abundan en la zona y que en las noches estos regresen solos a sus respectivos corrales. Cuando los animales que crían ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo ellos los venden a los negociantes que continuamente visitan el lugar. En el caso de Gusnara esta actividad le provee de algunas ganancias, las cuales le sirven para ayudar a su esposo, que es agricultor, con el sostenimiento de la familia.

Gusnara desea adquirir mas animales para engordarlos y venderlos, de modo que pueda percibir un ingreso adicional que le permita sacar adelante a su familia, siguiendo su objetivo trazado se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles.

Gusnara es una mujer entregada a su familia y que siempre vela por el bienestar de los suyos, en la zona donde vive ella es muy estimada y respetada por sus vecinos que la consideran alguien amable y honrada. En la imagen aparece junto a uno de sus hijos y a sus animales.
texts.en:
Gusnara is 55 years old and lives with her husband and children in the small village of Hualtacal in the Olmos District, an area known regionally for having the majority of its population scattered throughout outlying areas. They work in agriculture and in raising livestock in the province of Lambayeque, located a little over two hours from the city of Chicalayo. Gusnara has worked for three years raising smaller animals such as sheep and pigs. It is normal for the village settlers to let their animals roam freely in the abundant countryside, and at night, the animals each return to their respective farmyards. When the animals reach a good size, they sell them to traders who routinely visit the area. This provides Gusnara some earnings that allow her to help her spouse, a farmer, to support the family. Gusnara would like to acquire more animals to fatten and to sell so that she can receive additional income that would help her sustain her family. With this objective in mind, she is compelled to request a loan for the first time through Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of $300. Gusnara is a woman devoted to her family, always looking out for their collective well-being. In the area in which she lives, she is well respected by her neighbors, who consider her to be kind and honest. In the photo, she appears with one of her children and her animals.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sheep and pigs to fatten and to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Soledad

texts.en:
Ma. Soledad A. is from the village of Gosi Norte, Tuguegarao City. She is 42 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Ma. Soledad owns and operates a general store from which she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Ma. Soledad has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2007, Ma. Soledad joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her seventh from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Gricelda

texts.es: Gricelda, de 42 años, es una mujer alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Edmundo (62) y sus 6 menores hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.Los largos días de trabajo que tiene en sus tierras, han hecho que se vuelva una gran conocedora de la agricultura, sus cultivos están muy bien cuidados y siempre consigue un buen precio por la venta de sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar la tierra, ya que es la actividad que realiza desde que era niña. Lleva 10 años realizando este trabajo y considera que lo más difícil  es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado de la ciudad, por lo accidentado de la carretera. Con el tiempo, espera comprar más tierras y así incrementar su producción.Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y esta ahorrando para pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las integrantes  de su banco comunal, donde se siente muy contenta de pertenecer a este grupo ya que todos trabajan con responsabilidad. Gricelda tiene planeado invertir  los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, en la compra de abono y fertilizantes, para hacer más productiva su tierra.
texts.en:
Gricelda, 42 years old, is a cheerful and hard-working woman. She lives in her own house with her husband Edmundo (62) and her 6 young children, who are the reason for all her efforts. The long hours of work that she has put into her land have taught her much about agriculture. Her crops are well-known and always fetch a good price when she sells them. What she likes most about her work is cultivating the land, which is something she has done since she was a girl. She has spent the last 10 years in this work, and considers the most difficult part to be transporting her crops to market in the city because of the uneven highway. With time, she hopes to buy more land and thus increase her production. This is the second loan she has gotten from MFP and is saving to make her payments on time. She does not want to cause problems for the members of her communal bank; she is happy to belong to this group where everyone works responsibly. Gricelda plans to use the two thousand nuevos soles she is asking for to buy manure and fertilizer to make her land more productive.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Powell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers for her crops

loans.name: Umaru J.'s Group

texts.en:
In the photo above are members of the staff of the Kankalay Isamic Primary School Madina village. These diligent and hard-working teachers have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of SLL 10,800,000 in order to help them pay school fees for their children or invest in business or buy pieces of furniture, or a plot of land, etc. Kankalay Isamic Primary School Madina was founded in 1997 in Madina village. The school is staffed with 11 teachers and has 350 pupils. 

Umaru J. K. is the leader of this group. He is a 54-year-old man. He is married to a teacher and they have six children – five in primary school and one in secondary school. Umaru will use his share (SLL 1,200,000)  of this loan to invest in his business. 

Umaru has served the teaching profession for 28 good years, but for 10 years now, he has backed up his teaching work with some petty trading. In this way, he is able to get additional funds to supplement his meager monthly salary as a school teacher.

loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita D. is a married woman who lives in Tangkong II, Barangay Sillon, Bantayan, Cebu. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures: a general store and a pig fattening business. Her husband, Manuel D., who is 50 years old, works as a family driver to earn his living and he also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 2 children who are 24 and 26 years old. 

Conchita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 cycle loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Conchita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 22,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 17th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500, which she intends to use as additional capital so that she can continue to save up for their future and to fight the daily battle of their lives. Conchita D. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital.

loans.name: Eliseo Ramon

texts.es:
Don Eliseo tiene la edad de 42 años, comerciante de su propio negocio, venta de chatarra que desde hace cinco años ha venido invirtiendo en este, el cual trabaja con dos hijos. Las dificultades es que a veces no cuenta con mucho capital cuando le sale buena cantidad de chatarra.

Lo que quiere comenzar hacer es un pequeño muro ya que una correntada pasa por su vivienda lo que quiere desviar al levantar las paredes del muro, ya que se le ha hecho muy incómodo por el agua y que luego se convierte en mucho lodo, lo que produce mucho mosquito y mal higiene.

Comprara: bloques, hierro, cemento, estribos, arena, piedrin y lamina de zinc.
Para el ha sido estos financiamientos de gran oportunidad, logrando hacer sus mejoras.
texts.en:
Don Eliseo is 42 years old. He has his own business selling scrap. He has been investing in this business for five years and works with two of his children. The problem is that he does not always have much capital when a good amount of scrap becomes available. He wants to start building a small wall because a current runs by his home, and he wants to alter its course by building walls. Things have become very uncomfortable because of the water and because it creates a lot of mud, which produces mosquitoes and unsanitary conditions. He will buy: blocks, iron, cement, supports, sand, piedrin [a type of building stone] and zinc sheets. These loans have been a great opportunity for him, allowing him to make his improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction materials to build a small wall to prevent water from entering his house

loans.name: Maka

texts.en:
Maka F. is 33 and married with a child.  She plants and harvests taro for sale. Maka has many years of experience in this business.  

Maka needs a loan of 1,000 Samoan talas to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or about $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Maka joined SPBD. This is her first loan with SPBD.  SPBD's loans are Maka's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Him

texts.en: Him M., 46, is a widow and lives with three children in the Kampong Chhnang province. She works in a grocery store, typically making $2 US of profit a day. She is also supported by one child who works as a garment factory worker. Him M. is asking for a loan of $300 to increase her stock of grocery items.

loans.use: expanding store inventory

loans.name: Jullieta

texts.en:
Jullieta S. is from the village of Sinian, Baliangao. She is 48 years old, married and has three adult children. To make a living, Julieta owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, particularly in fishing. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling of ocean-caught fish in the local community. Julieta has been engaged in her business for more than 18 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2003, Julieta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julieta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. Jullieta is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used for fishing. This loan will be the 11th loan taken out by Julieta from PMPC. 


About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for fishing

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda A. is from the village of Brgy. Uddiawan, Solano,Nueva Vizcaya. She is 55 years old, married and has 2 adult children. Emelda owns & operates a handicraft business where she sells plastic handicrafts to tourists and local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month..

In 2008, Emelda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts. Emelda is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional handicrafts to sell. This will be her 4th from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional handicrafts to sell

loans.name: Paula De Jesús

texts.es: Paula de Jesús H. de 64 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San Vicente, en donde vive junto a su hija, su madre y su pequeña nieta. Paula es una señora la cual trabaja para sostener su hogar y sus necesidades personales, se dedica a la venta de ropa para mujeres, niños y hombre, su venta se encuentra sobre la calle principal del barrio El Calvario en el departamento de San Vicente, un lugar en el cual cuenta con una ubicación muy buena debido a que las personas que se dirigen hacia el mercado pasan enfrente de su puesto y así mismo esta calle es una de las vías principales de San Vicente por lo que es muy transitado. Paula cuenta con muy buenas ventas por lo que desea aumentar su inventario, sobre todo comprar mayor cantidad de pantalones y blusas para mujer, los cuales son los que más vende. Es por esta razón que ella solicita un préstamo a Integral por medio del cual pueda lograr lo anterior, esto lo hace con el gran deseo de mejorar sus ventas y de esta forma vivir de una forma más estable junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Paula de Jesús H., 64, lives in San Vicente department with her daughter, mother and little granddaughter.  Paula is a woman who works to support her home and for her personal needs.  She sells women’s, men’s and children’s clothing on the main street of  El Calvario neighborhood, San Vicente department, a place that is very well situated because people heading to the market pass by in front of her stand and this street is one of San Miguel’s main thoroughfares so it has a lot of traffic.

Paula tells us that sales are very good so she wants to increase stock inventory, especially of women’s pants and blouses, which are the items that sell best.

For this reason, therefore, she is asking Integral for a loan to accomplish the above.  She does this hoping to improve sales in order to live with her family with more stability.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rosalinda's Group

texts.en:
Rosalinda A. is from the village of Mabantad, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 35 years old. Rosalinda is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Rosalinda is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalinda owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Rosalinda has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosalinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalinda is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Rosalinda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Benjamin Mwanzia

texts.en:
Benjamin is a 36 year-old businessman who runs a general store at Umoja innercore Estate, which is a highly populated estate. He is married to Annastaia Ngina, who is 26 years old, and they have a two-year-old daughter. 

Benjamin has been running his general store for four years and his monthly income is 24,500 KES. He was introduced to KADET by another client and is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to buy 25 bags of flour (each bag costs 2,000 KES). This is his first loan with KADET, and if his business improves, Benjamin will help the needy such as orphans and helping develop nearby schools. 

Benjamin describes himself as a hardworking person who dreams of lifting the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy flour

loans.name: Angela Maria

texts.es:
la joven Angela E. tiene 27 años de edad, vive en el caserio La Lomita de la ciudad de Choluteca, Angelica se dedica a la cria y venta de cerdos, le vende sus cerdos a carniceros que destazan en San Lorenzo y Choluteca, ahorita tiene un pedido grande de cerdos ya que para la epoca de navidad muchas personas comen cerdo en la cena navideña.
Angela trabaja muy fuerte para sacar adelante a sus 2 hijos, Angela cuenta con buenos principios morales y religiosos.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar cerdos, su meta es seguir creciendo como microempresaria y de esta manera tener una mejor calidad de vida para ella y para sus hijos.
su sueño es darles una buena educacion a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Angela E. is 27 years old; she lives in the community of Limita in the city of Choluteca.  Angela raises and sells pigs. She sells her livestock to butchers in the cities of San Lorenzo and Choluteca. She has a large order for pigs for the Christmas season when many people eat pork meat for the Christmas supper. 

Angela works very hard to support her 2 children. Angela depends on sound personal principles, moral and religious. 

She will use the loan to purchase more pigs. Her goal is to keep growing as a small business owner and to provide a better quality of life for herself and her children. 

Her dream is to give her kids a good education.

loans.use: To purchase pigs and feed.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en: Elisa B. is a widow who lives in Barangay 8, Isabela, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a food vending (native delicacies) business. Elisa joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 18 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Elisa has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 15,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 9,000 PHP, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 19th loan, she is borrowing 15,000 PHP, which she intends to use to buy ingredients for the food she makes so that she can continue to save up for future home repairs. Elisa B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue in its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: Fund the operation of a native foods/delicacies business

loans.name: Laura Moserrate

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Crucita, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Laura, ella tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos, tres ya son  mayores de edad y el menor tiene 12 años y estudia en colegio, sus hijos  aun viven con ella. Su esposo es pescador. Es socia del Banco Comunal hace ya por 9 años y le gusta porque les han ayudado mucho para salir adelante.

Ella es una ama de casa que para ayudar  a su esposo realiza los créditos para el trabajo o negocio del esposo el cual se dedica a la pesca y venta de los frutos que el mar les da,  trabaja todos los días, hay días que junto a otras personas se van a alta mar desde la tarde y regresan al otro dia  por la mañana para entregar sus productos a comerciantes que llegan  hasta sus pangas para llevarlos a los mercados de otras ciudades.
 
Este crédito es para comprar combustibles, redes y otros materiales necesarios para la pesca. Sus sueños son que siempre haya buena pesca.
texts.en:
In the Crucita parish on Portoviejo street, the members of the Crucita Communal Bank meet. The area is known for its beautiful beaches that surround this lovely place and are frequented by local and foreign tourists who know the locale as Crucita la Bella.

In this place we meet Laura. She is 46 years old. She is married, and from this marriage she has four children. Three are already grown and the youngest is 12 years old and goes to school. All her children still live with her. Her husband is a fisherman. She has been a member of the communal bank for nine years, and she likes it because it has greatly helped her to move forward.

She is a housewife, who, to help her husband, gets the loans for his business. His business is fishing and selling the fruit that the ocean gives him. He works every day. There are some days that he goes out to high sea with other people in the afternoon and comes back the next morning to deliver his goods to vendors who visit his canoes to get the fish and take them to markets in other cities.

This loan is to purchase fuel, nets, and other materials needed for fishing. Her dream is that there will always be good fish.

loans.use: Purchase fuel, nets, and other materials for fishing

loans.name: Claudia Carolina

texts.es:
Claudia de 29 años de edad, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, vive en casa propia es madre soltera de una hija de 3 años de edad, se dedica a vender comida en un local al interior del mercado municipal.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería para el puesto de venta, realmente la inversión la hará en comestibles, como pollo, carnes, verduras, frijoles, condimentos, estos productos ella los necesita a diario para preparar los diferentes menús y ofrecer a los clientes.
Su propósito es realizar inversiones al negocio para que sea fuerte y pueda atender la demanda de comida, también desea mejorar su condición económica.
texts.en:
Claudia is 29 years old; she lives in El Transito in the department of San Miguel. She lives in her own home. She is a single mom of a 3-year old girl. She sells foods from a stand in the municipal market. 

She requests a loan to purchase merchandise for her stand. The investment will actually be in the purchase of ingredients, such as chicken, meats, vegetables, beans, and condiments. These products are required daily to prepare the menu that she offers her clients. 

Her goal is to invest in her business to strengthen it and to meet client demand for her foods.  She also wants to improve her financial situation.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients.

loans.name: C1907 Abagamijiterambere Group

texts.en:
Agnes is 42 years old. She is the president of a group called 'Abagamijiterambere'. She is wearing the red shirt on the left side, the second person, first row. Agnes owns a little shop. She sells variety products such as rice, sugar, bread, cooking oil, etc. She has been in this business for about three years; the shop is open from 5am until 9pm every day. She currently employs ten people.

Agnes will use the loan to purchase more products to sell. She plans to save in the future and continue to invest in the business.

"Abagamijiterambere" is a group of eight people, three men and five women. Agnes and her group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their businesses. Once their businesses are expanded, they hope to satisfy their customers and earn more profits.

loans.use: Expanding her store

loans.name: Armida Zuleyma

texts.es:
Armida, D. 34 años D. edad, resiD. en San Francisco Gotera, departamento D. Morazán, se dedica a la venta D. Frutas, verduras, tostadas D. plátano y yuca.
El negocio D. ella es ofrecer frutas D. temporada, verduras, su hija D. 16 años le ayuda a vender por las calles D. la ciudad, actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para comprar materiales D. construcción para afinar el piso D. la vivienda y otra parte invertirlo en el negocio, específicamente en frutas, yuca y plátanos. Esta inversión le ayudara a mejorar no solo con la vivienda sino también en el negocio. 
Los sueños D. Armida es en un futuro contar con una vivienda más bonita, en mejores condiciones, ampliarla con un cuarto, también quiere que su hija tenga un futuro diferente, que estudie y pueda superarse.
texts.en:
Armida, 34, lives in San Francisco Gotera, Morazán department.  She sells fruit, vegetables and fried bananas and manioc.  Her business consists in selling seasonal fruit and vegetables.  Her 16-year-old daughter helps her sell throughout the city streets.  

She is asking for a loan to buy building materials and supplies to improve the floor in her house and part of it to invest in the business, specifically in fruit, manioc and bananas.  This investment will help her improve not only her house but also her business.

Armida’s dream for the future is to have a prettier house; one in better condition, enlarged with the addition of a bedroom.  She also wants her daughter to have a different future; that she study so that she can improve herself.

loans.use: To buy cement and sand to repair the floor in her house.

loans.name: Poor Nor Good Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Poor Nor Good” group. They are small scale business people based in Waterloo, a small town near Freetown. These small scale business people are requesting a loan of SLL 800,000 each from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to increase their business inventories. In this way, they will make more sales, better profit and consequently improves their living conditions. 

The leader of this group is Osman K.. Osman was born in Makeni, he is married to a businesswoman and the couple has four children. For five years now, Osman has been a businessman selling cameras, photo albums, film, etc. Osman will use his share of the loan to buy the above mentioned items in bulk to add to his business. This will help Osman generate more profit to pay school fees for his children and improve his standard of living.

(Also included in the left of the photo is loan officer Kadiatu Bah handing over the loan to the borrowers.)

loans.use: to buy cameras, photo albums, film, etc.

loans.name: My

texts.en:
Mr. My T. and his wife, Mrs. Eun Y, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have three children, one son and two daughters. Two children are married and live outside the family home and the third has full-time employment.  

My and his wife used to be weavers. However, they stopped their weaving business. My now sells finished silk and cotton fabrics. He buys them from his fellow villagers for resale in other provinces that are far from his house. His wife sells Khmer noodle and Num Banh Chok in her village. Khmer noodles are considered the national dish of Cambodia, served with a green curry soup and banana flowers, bean sprouts, water lily stalks and cucumber. 

My is requesting a loan of $500 to supplement his funds to purchase a motorcycle for his daughter to get to work.

loans.use: To supplement his funds to purchase a motorcycle for his daughter to get to work.

loans.name: Desarrollo Para El Progreso 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Angel lives in Samana, the northeastern region of the Dominican Republic. This city is a mountainous region where one of the principal industries is tourism. And in one of the most rural areas, Angel and this group of 15 members are taking loans for their businesses, this group is named Desarrollo para el Progreso 1, 2 & 3 (Development to progress).

Angel requires a loan to buy a coconut tree to sell coconuts all over the city and on different beaches. This is his second loan with Esperanza International, and he decided to take out a loan with us because he feels comfortable with the payments and especially because these loans are for businesses. He is very excited to belong to this group of neighbors doing business for the improvement of their families and the community. He will take a step toward having one of his dreams come true — having his own business — and he knows that by working hard, he will improve his business and be able to save and provide any help his children require.

Angel says that his favorite thing is to work, especially in the land, by planting different trees and seeding. He hopes that the profit from his business will be enough to buy his own vehicle and to have a business without debts.

loans.use: To buy a coconut tree

loans.name: Vallecito Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VALLECITO”; Este banco está ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac,  provincia de Cusco y  departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Vilma: es conviviente y tiene 34 años de edad; la socia tiene 2 hijos; la socia se dedica  a la realización de bisutería, ella elabora a mano y los vende, la socia trabaja vendiendo todo tipo de bisutería desde hace 4 años, la socia realiza trabajos como collares, aretes de cuarzo y piedras, pulseras de colores y con acabados lindos y bien decorados. L a socia desea el crédito para poder comprar materiales para la elaboración de sus trabajos ella compra desde hilos, alambres, mostacillas, piedras, ganchitos, cadenetas, y mucho más para realizar los diferentes trabajos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para realizar sus trabajos y continuar con el crecimiento de su negocio.
 
Los otros socios del banco comunal se dedican a la venta de comidas caceras; movilidad escolar; albañiles, taxista; carpintero; tienda abarrotes; bazar- librería. 


La socia está muy agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Sra. Vilma is a member of the Communal Bank “Vallecito” which is located in the District of Huanchac, Province and Department of Cusco.

She is 34 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children. Vilma earns her living by producing trinkets by hand and selling them. She has been selling all kinds of trinkets for four years. Her work involves making necklaces, earrings of quartz and stones, and colorful bracelets with bright finishes and ornate decorations. Vilma needs a loan to buy materials for making her creations such as thread, wire, beads, stones, hooks, miniature chains, and other supplies. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of these materials for her work so that she can continue to grow her business.

The other members of the Communal Bank engage in selling homemade meals, school tranportation, masonry, providing taxi services, carpentry, selling groceries, and operating a bazaar and bookstore.

Sra. Vilma is extremely grateful for the loan and promises to complete her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase materials for producing handmade trinkets.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita is 61 years old and married with three children. She has been raising pigs for 20 years and also earns additional income from charcoal sales. Nenita is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ritah

texts.en:
Ritah is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has three children. All of her children are currently in school. Ritah has a business of selling clothes, which she has had for one year.         

To help expand her business, Ritah has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Ritah hopes to generate greater profits and pay for school for herself. In the future, Ritah hopes to complete her studies. Ritah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her learn how to save money.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Belta

texts.en:
Belta was born in 1968; she is married to Mr. Phillip  and is the mother of seven children all above the age of 15. They are living at Elemighong, a quarter in Belo Sub Division, North West Region of Cameroon.

Belta has faced major challenges in her life especially sickness and poverty. The most difficult have been the problem of raising capital for her business and paying for her children’s education.  She plans to invest this loan in selling Irish potatoes and rearing goats. She will be able to raise a lot of profit from the business because it is highly demanded in her community. She believes the business will succeed because she has been in the business for a long time and so she has experience as far as the business is concerned, and she has successfully borrowed and repaid a loan one time already from GHAPE. This loan was invested in buying and selling Irish potatoes. She also thinks her approach to her customers will be captivating and hence lead to the success of her business. The loan will help her community because they will be able to afford Irish potatoes at a very low cost.

Belta will plough back her profit into her business and use part to care for her family. She also will use the proceeds to pay her children's tuition fees, and save some for a rainy day. She prefers GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives and the low cost in obtaining and paying back the loan.

About GHAPE 

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes and goats for resale.

loans.name: Eriolyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Eriolyn works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and earns additional income from buying and selling chicken and hotdogs. Eriolyn is borrowing PHP 11,500 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for the maintenance and repair of her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business.

Eriolyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to afford to send her child to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials to maintain and repair her motorcycle

loans.name: Qubuhlu Group

texts.en:
Ntanga is 57 years old and single, with six children, one of whom attends school. For the last six years, she has been selling fabric and other materials to make handicrafts out of her home. She also receives a grant from the South African government to support her children. In the photo she is raising her hand.

Eventually, Ntanga would like to open a fabric store. The biggest challenge that she faces is that her customers take her stock on credit but do not pay, which causes her to be late on making loan repayments. With the profits from this loan, she believes that she will be able to build a house for her family.

Ntaga says that WDB has helped her a lot and is the first company that has offered to help a poor person like her.

loans.use: to buy fabric, paint, and other materials for resale.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a married woman with 6 children. She is 59 years old and has a sari-sari (variety) store business. She sells items like eggs, canned goods and sugar. She also sells hog feeds and rice to the people in her community. She usually earns about 3,000 PHP (~$75) per month with her business.

Josefina is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy more items to sell, such as canned goods, hog feed and rice.

In the future, Josefina hopes to have a bigger store. She also hopes that her two younger children will be able to finish college and find jobs.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, such as canned goods, hog feed and rice.

loans.name: 19 Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Mrs Vân operates a food stall selling meat. She is requesting a loan to purchase cattle for sale.

Vân is 49 years old and married with three children. She is the leader of a nine-member group, the 19 Điện Biên solidarity group. 
Vân lives with three dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2009, Vân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Vân has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for seven years.

The main hardship that Vân faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Vân hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

The extra snapshot is Ms Sen. She came late, so we took a separate photo and collaged it with other people.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to process for sale.

loans.name: Ste Trinite Group

texts.fr: Le groupe STE TRINITE est composé de trois  personnes qui habitent dans la même maison. C'est la deuxième fois  que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante  du groupe, du nom de Noélie est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Noélie est âgée de 30 ans et vit au Bénin. Noélie  est mariée à un enseignant du nom de Marcellin. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Noélie a très peu  fréquenté l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Noélie prépare de la nourriture (riz accampagné de sauce) qu'elle vend à son domicile. Noélie mène cette activité depuis six ans environs. Noélie s’approvisionne dans l’un des marchés du  Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Noélie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe STE TRINITE, un deuxième crédit. le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The group STE TRINITE is comprised of three persons who live in the same house. This is the second time that this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé for elevating its level of business. The group’s representative, by the name of Noélie, is the person with her hand raised in the photo. She is 30 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a teacher by the name of Marcellin, and they have three children, who are all in school and in their care. 

Noélie did not have much schooling. To support herself and her children, she makes meals (rice served with sauce) that she sells out of her home. She has been in this business for about six years. She gets her supplies from one of the markets in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and her revenues, she and the other members of the group STE TRINITE are requesting a second loan. The first one was indeed repaid.

loans.use: to buy sauce condiments and some rice

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 36 years old with four children. One of the children is disabled and three of them are in school. She is a widow. She has a business of a hotel (restaurant) in Buluk in Juba, South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years.

Susan requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She says that the profit from her loan will help her to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase plates, glasses and chairs for her hotel (restaurant)

loans.name: Marima

texts.en:
Marima , 41 years old, is married with three children, two of whom are in school. He does mixed farming i.e. rearing sheep, goats, cattle and he is also a wheat farmer. He has been doing this for the past eight years.

He learned about KADET LTD through a KADET staff member. He repaid his previous loan successful and has applied for his third loan which he plans to spend partly on farming and partly on purchasing more sheep for fattening.

He hopes to make a profit and to use it to educate his children. He dreams of expanding his business.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and sheep to rear and sell later at a profit

loans.name: Martin

texts.es: El sr. Martin nació en la ciudad de Potosí, actualmente radica en esta localidad de el torno en el barrio, se vino a esta localidad escapando de la sequia que sufrió en un época el norte de Potosí donde perdió todos sus sembradíos, ahora le va muy bien el se dedica a la construcción es albañil contratista,   cuenta con casa propia,  esta casado con la Sra. Rufina esposa la Sra. Rufina, ella  se dedica a la venta de pan, con tres hijos que  estudian y trabajan , han solicitado un crédito para la compra de  materiales de construcción,  es cliente antiguo y responsable por lo tanto nuevamente están muy agradecidos con la institución por el apoyo económico que les ha brindado  para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sr. Martin was born in the city of Potosí. He currently lives in a neighborhood in the town of El Torno. Martin moved to this town in order to escape the drought that ravaged northern Potosí, where he lost all of his crops. Now he is doing well in the construction sector as a bricklaying contractor. Martin has his own house. He is married to Sra. Rufina, who sells bread. They have three children who study and work.

Martin is requesting a loan to buy construction materials. He is a longtime client who is responsible. Once again, Martin is very grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided so that he can improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for his job as a bricklayer.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Gemma has a retail shop that sells detergent, soap & cosmetics from PERSONAL CARE & other brands. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy detergent, soap & beauty products to sell. Gemma is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Gemma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy detergent, soap & beauty products to sell

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is 38-years-old and lives in the town of Nebbi in the Arua region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 3 years Alfred has been working hard to manage his small shop which sells clothes and materials. 

To help expand his business, Alfred has requested a loan of 1,200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more rolls of lining and other supplies and will help Alfred to generate greater profits and support his family. Alfred hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business by opening new branches. 

Alfred is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Alfred who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more rolls of cloth.

loans.name: Kyebbumba Anti Hiv/aids Group

texts.en: Gereva wants to buy bulls to rear and sell during the festive season of Christmas. He joined a group to be able to access a loan. Age 45 years, he started his livestock rearing farm from sales of agricultural produce. He dreams of educating his six children and wants to acquire a motorcycle to ease his transport problem.

loans.use: to buy bulls for resale

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: La socia Maria, sigue trabajando con la compra y venta de materiales de construcci{on, la socia compra al por mayor ladrillos, cemento, bloquetas, arena, fierros,la socia en esta ocasi{on tambien desea invertir el prestamo junto a un ahorro que tiene guardado para aumentar en el primer pago para el envio de los materiales de construccion a la socia, la socia comprara cemento, fierros, arena, ladrillos y los traeran de Arequipa y Juliaca, la socia pagara el primer envio y para ello requiere el prestamo para aumentar a lo que tiene, ella desea implementar a futuro su negocio y mejorar sus ventas y seguir creciendo.
texts.en: Our member, Maria, buys and sells construction materials.  She buys wholesale supplies of bricks, cement, cement blocks, sand, iron bar, etc.  She plans to combine the loan with her own savings to make an initial payment for the merchandise she needs.  She will use the funds to buy cement, iron bar, sand and bricks in Arequipa and Juliaca that she will then sell locally.  She needs the loan to cover the amount she needs over and above her savings.  For the future, she wants to establish a solid business and grow it year in and year out.

loans.use: to stock her construction supplies business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married to a driver and has four children. She lives with her family at Besease. For the past five years, Mary has been producing gari (cassava flour) and she uses the income from her business to help her husband support her family. 

Mary is requesting a loan to by cassava in bulk to produce gari. With the profit from her loan, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy cassava to produce flour (gari)

loans.name: Amancia

texts.en:
Amancia is a 64-year-old widow with 2 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Amancia has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Amancia requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Amancia has been in this business for 30 years. Amancia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers

loans.name: María Argelia

texts.es: María Argelia  de 63 años de edad, habita en su propia casa junto con su grupo familiar el cual está formado por sus tres nietos y su esposo el cual se dedica a la agricultura. La señora María se caracteriza por ser amable, dedicada pero sobre todo trabajadora. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de deliciosas tortillas. Cada mañana se levanta a tempranas horas de la mañana para preparar todos los ingredientes de las tortillas a fin de tenerlas a tiempo cuando los clientes las soliciten. A  pesar de su avanzada edad no se da por vencida, para ella es muy importante mantener su negocio ya que de esta manera colabora con la economía del hogar que muchas veces no alcanza a cubrir todas las necesidades. Ella es muy emprendedora siempre está pensando en la forma de hacer crecer su negocio. Últimamente ha pensado mucho en la posibilidad de hacer un préstamo para invertir en la tortillería a fin de de tener una mayor oferta para sus clientes de tal forma que esto le permita atraer a más clientes. Todo esto la llevo a tomar la decisión de de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de los insumos (maíz, agua, cal, gas propano, etc.) necesarios para seguir produciendo y ofreciendo las deliciosa tortillas. Todo esto lo hace con el objetivo de mejorar sus niveles de venta y de ingresos de tal forma que su calidad de vida y la de su familia mejoren.
texts.en: Maria Argelia, who is 63 years old, lives in her own house with her family group, which is formed by her three grandchildren and her husband, who works in agriculture. Señora Maria is characterized by being kind, dedicated, and, above all, hard-working. Her work is making and selling delicious tortillas. Every morning she gets up in the early hours of the morning to prepare all the ingredients for the tortillas, so that she will have them ready when the customers ask for them. In spite of her advanced age, she does not give up. For her, it is very important to maintain her business, since in this way she contributes to the household finances, which often are not sufficient to cover all the necessities. She is very enterprising. She is always thinking of ways to make her business grow. Finally, she thought a lot about the possibility of getting a loan to invest in her tortilla shop, with the goal of having a better supply for her customers so that it would allow her to attract more customers. All this brought her to take the decision to apply for a loan at INTEGRAL to invest in the purchase of the ingredients (corn, water, lime, propane gas, etc) necessary to continue producing and offering the delicious tortillas. She does all this with the goal of improving her levels of sales and income in such a way that her quality of life and that of her family will improve.

loans.use: to buy corn, water, lime, propane gas, etc.

loans.name: Sokvannara

texts.en:
Sokvannara (in the photo) is 30 year old and her husband, Vit is 29 years old. They have been married since 2001 and have two children-one son and one daughter. One child is in school and the other one is still young. The family lives with Vit's mother in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.  

Sokvannara and her husband are rice farmers. In addition, they also raise cows at home. When the cows are fully grown, they will sell them for beef. 

Sokvannara is asking for a loan of $1,200 to assist in her farming business by buying seeds, paying for plow fees and buying additional cows to raise.

loans.use: in her farming business by buying seeds, paying for plow fees and buying additional cows to raise.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 57 years old, married to Tabitha, and they are blessed with five children. He has been in the farming business for the past ten years with a monthly income of Kes 15,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan with KADET Ltd of Kes 27,635, after being introduced by a KADET staff member. He will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. 

His hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.ru: Заррина жительница города Исфары. Ей 44 года. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Ее муж работает в Российской Федерации. Сама она имеет средне – специальное образование, стоматолог. На сегодняшний день Заррина занимается изготовлением и установкой зубных протезов и зубных коронок. В этой области она работает 20 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения аппарата для изготовления зубных протезов и коронок из металлокерамики.
texts.en: Zarrina is a resident of the city of Isfara.  She is 44 years old, married and has three children.  Her husband works in the Russian Federation.  Zarrina has a secondary-specialized education as a dentist.  Today, Zarrina is involved in manufacturing and installing teeth prosthetics and crowns.  She has been in this business for 20 years.  She is requesting this loan to purchase equipment for making prosthetics and crowns from metal-ceramics.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for making prosthetics and crowns from metal-ceramics

loans.name: Caminando Juntos Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Caminando Juntos” está conformado por 18 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran venta de celulares, tornería, confección de ropa, cortinaje, artesanía, venta de leña, entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Temuco.
